My stay with Kevin was my first AirBnB experience and I'm extremely satisfied. Everything about the apartment and neighborhood, and even parking was very accurate.  I was unsure of whether or not I would have an extra person with me, and when it turns out I did, the extra air matress was already out and set up. 

Kevin was very flexibile, easy to get in contact with and overall a really cool dude. I wish he was in town so that I could have had a chance to hang out and chat it up.  I'm highly recommending this spot for anyone going to NYC for a visit.

Wir haben uns sehr wohlgefühlt in Kevins Wohnung. Wir hatten viel Platz (Kevin war nicht da), die Umgebung ist wunderschön, Bagelshop um die Ecke, Bio-Supermarkt vor der Haustür, die Unionhall mit ihrer Indoor Bocciabahn und dem guten Biersortiment die Straße runter. Auf der Treppe sitzen und mit den Hausbewohnern quatschen war schön, alles sehr locker und entspannt.

Nice spot perfectly located near restaurants and Prospect park.  The space met our needs. The only issues was that the bathroom was not clean.  I was reminded numerous times by the owner that i was not staying at a hotel, which I didn't need to hear repeatedly.  That bothered quite a bit. Nonetheless, the space worked.

Kevin was absent when we stayed the week in Brooklyn but kept in touch by message if we needed to know anything.  We slept like babies after our day in NY and although the road is busy during the day you don.t hear the traffic and at night the road is quiet.  It was perfect for us and within easy reach of all the different subway lines. Great experience pity we did not get to meet you Kevin.

The apartment is exactly as shown in pictures.  The place is very clean and well kept, and has most everything you need.  The neighborhood is great and safe. Communication with Kevin was easy and he was prompt, and courteous .  Overall we had a wonderful stay and would highly recommend Kevin's place.

We've had a wonderful stay at park slope. The apartment is such good value for money, it has all you need and the public transport to visit manhattan is very close. 
The neighborhood is beautiful and safe!

The space is huge for NYC and Kevin was a great host - full of recommendations and very welcoming.  Park Slope is a great area to stay, with tons of good places to eat and drink nearby as well as the Prospect Park and the Brooklyn Museum and Botanical Garden.

Kevin was a perfect host! Very welcoming and helpful! I really have no complaints! The neighborhood was quiet and safe, and very close to the subway to Manhattan! Many restaurants and grocery stores around! The house was exactly what we needed. Great experience.

Our stay in Kevin's apartment was great. Kevin was friendly and accommodating at all times. We did not see him often as he was working and left early in the day and we were often out and about. 
However when we did he was really helpful and chatty. The location was excellent for us as we were visiting our son, daughter in law and baby who live only a few streets away. Park Slope is a great area, the apartment easily accessible to the subway and many restaurants. Bogota on 5th Avenue has great Columbian food and really good service. Prospect Park is just up Union St and lovely to walk or ride around. Hoping to visit Brooklyn again in the near future !! Many thanks Kevin for your hospitality !!

Kevin made us feel very welcome. He is friendly and social. The two rooms are spacious and the bed is very comfortable. He was always conscientious that his use of the kitchen would not interfere with our plans to cook.

The location is great for exploring Brooklyn and Prospect Park, as well as for going into Manhattan. Five different subways lines are all a short walk away. 

The lovely bonsais outside our window were beautiful to look at and enjoy. 

We would recommend this AirBNB to anyone, and would enjoy staying here again.

Kevin was a wonderful host, provided some recommendations to some of the best food we have ever had.  We were in town for NY marathon and the location was perfect for accessing the subway system.  The nice quiet neighborhood is a great refuge from the hustle of the city and everything you need is within walking distance.  We highly recommend this place!

Kevin is a gracious and fantastic host. Communication was simple and he responded promptly. The room is perfect, plenty of workspace if one needs to get some tasks done while visiting a beautiful neighborhood. The Brooklyn Museum is a short walk away, along with the Botanical Gardens and all of Prospect Park.

L'appartement est très bien situé au cœur d'un quartier vivant et agréable de Brooklyn, a 10 mins à pied du métro et du Barclay's center. 
Kevin a été un hôte à la fois discret mais aussi disponible et sympathique, très agréable au quotidien. 
Nous étions 5 à voyager, le lit principal est sympa mais attention aux personnes de grande taille (limite au delà de 1m85).
Pour le reste le matelas gonflable était correct sans plus.

The place was perfect, as the pictures show, and the neighbour is the best place to stay at NY: quiet, safe, with a lot of options for food and drink and close to Manhattan by train. 
We met Kevin only one day, and he was friendly and helpful, giving us several tips to enjoy the city.
Bed confortable, bathroom only for us (Kevin was out most of the time), and the big livingroom is perfect to rest after a long day discovering NY.

Kevin made me feel welcome in his home. He is a genuine guy who both makes himself available, and allows you space as desired. The private bedroom and private living room provide a large space to call your own during your visit. Great location; near everything. Seven minute walk to 7th Ave Station (& Flatbush); five minute walk to Union Street Station (at Fourth Ave). I'll be back!

Very nice room with a large living room and an adjacent bedroom. Kevin is very relaxed. No drama. No headache. Nothing is a problem. He also can give a lot of tips/info on how best to navigate the city. 
This was my first time using airbnb so I was a bit nervous. We arrived much later than I thought (we went exploring the city before heading out to his place) and this was not a problem. I was traveling with my 8 y.o. who loved the place (and the music that Kevin was playing!) The neighborhood is fantastic.  Lots of great places to eat  and relax (like Cousin John's on 7th Ave...). Safe and accessible with at least 3 subway lines. About 15 minutes from Manhattan.  I loved leaving the city to get back to a quiet street to recharge before another day exploring and running around. Great place! 
(and you get to share a room with a bonsai!)

Very good landlord.
Kevin is so nice, and his house is clean and comfortable.
House is near subway and there is quiet at night.
If we will go to NY, this will be our first choice.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Kevin's Brownstone in Park Slope. The room was HUGE with cool antique details to explore throughout this area. This isn't a sterile boring Holiday Inn but instead a look into what it would be like to live in one of the nicest boroughs in Brooklyn. We explored the area  thoroughly and found a wonderful coffee shop just a couple of blocks away, an ice cream shop and juice bar just around another corner and tons of restaurants nearby. Kevin had plenty of advice for places to eat and see but since my daughter lives in another area of Brooklyn with several roommates, this was a perfect way to visit her without being crammed in with the craziness of that. The subway and bus system is quite close by and the neighborhood is beautiful to walk around and explore and it's very quiet at night unlike our last stay in the city. You can also take advantage of Uber and Lyft, our wait was never longer than 5 minutes for them to arrive.  This was my first AirBNB experience and it won't be my last.
Amazing host and place to stay ! Next to many helpful places, we enjoyed our stay

Great place to stay in Brooklyn. Pleasant atmosphere in the house, very comfortable  and  spacious. Close to many nice places to eat, walk and have fun and also close to several metro stations.  Great option to experience Brooklyn and also NYC :)

We had a great stay! Kevin's a terrific host: friendly, accommodating, easy-going, and equally happy to chat or leave you alone depending on what you'd like. The apartment is as classic Brooklyn as you could possibly ask for, in a gorgeous Brownstone. That means it's an older building, so don't expect brand-new amenities. You'll get some noise from the street (although the French doors into the bedroom do a lot to mitigate that). But you get a ton of space, and the fun of staying in an old-school New York beauty. 

And let's face it, when you come to NYC, you're going to be going out and enjoying the town, not hanging around the apartment all day long. You're paying for the location, and the location here is absolutely INCREDIBLE. Tons of fantastic shops and restaurants right out the door on 5th and 7th Avenues, just a few minutes' walk to Prospect Park (one of my hands-down favorite places in the world), and a quick walk to basically every subway line you could possibly need. 

We had a great stay with Kevin, and I hope we'll get to stay with him again the next time we're in town!

Well, about the kevin´s apartment I want to say; first off all,  he is very honest, we leave forgot  a Tablet  and he return  it to us. About our stay, we find  things that were not comfortable to us.  The TV do not have a good signal, we can´t see TV confortable.  the doorknobs (included the door of the bathroom)  do not have form to put secure, so always are open.
the smell of the apartment is nasty,  is not true that have washing machine,  one of the mattress is an Inflatable mattres   and you wake up in a flatmattres, there is just one fat for too romos.In 12 days they do not change sheets  and they did not  take care of the apartment, ad the tub was covered.
However he try to be nice person with us but we consider , he cant not supply  that service.
 
Thanks.
Thank you Kevin!! We really enjoyed your home!!

Unser Wohnerlebnis in Kevins Haus war sehr positiv. Hier wohnt man sehr familiär. Man vertraut sich gegenseitig und und das ist ein prima Gefühl. Wir waren viel unterwegs und haben Kevin daher nicht viel gesehen. Trotzdem konnten wir einige gute Hinweise von ihm bekommen. Er beantwortet gerne jede Frage und wenn man ein gemeinsames Thema hat, kann man leicht ins "Ratschen" kommen. Das Appartment befindet sich im EG eines alten Brownstone. Die Möblierung ist genau wie auf dem Bild, zum Teil etwas gebraucht, aber alles in einem ordentlichen und sehr sauberen Zustand. Es ist recht zweckmäßig eingerichtet, hat viele Steckdosen, einen schönen großen Spiegel, und eine kuschelige Bettnische mit angenehm fester Matratze. Auch das gemeinsam benutzte Bad ist absolut sauber. Die Lage ist sehr gut, da die öffentlichen Verkehrsmittel in wenigen Minuten erreichbar sind. Auf der Straße vor dem Haus herrscht reger Geschäftsverkehr mit damit verbundener Geräuschkulisse. 
Bei unserem nächsten New York Besuch fragen wir gerne wieder bei Kevin an. Alles Gute weiterhin!

Kevin is very friendly and made me feel welcome. The neighborhood is excellent and so safe! And I was so close to my daughter's place which was an added plus. All the amenities were great. Be sure to bring shampoo and hair dryer if you need it for your stay. For a shared apt, the space was very nice because you have your own living room, too. Thanks, Kevin!

Thank you Kevin, you are so nice, our kids all like you very much! Your house is comfortable,and is well placed for easy access to anywhere  and convenient for shopping. If we have chanc to come to NY again, we would like to stay your house again.

Though he was out of town, Kevin helped us feel right at home. His apartment is comfortable and bright, and his location can't be beat: within easy walking distance of several subways, as well as shops and restaurants.

My buddy and I drove up from North Carolina for our friends' wedding in Brooklyn. Basically, we just needed a safe spot to leave our stuff and a couple of beds to lay our heads on after long, celebratory nights. Kevin was welcoming and accommodating, especially since we got in very late the first night. The neighborhood was very nice and safe, and we came and went as we pleased. He left us to ourselves and our friends, giving us space to do what we needed to. The only issue was an air mattress he had purchased for our stay was not working properly and gave my buddy a pretty poor night's sleep. Kevin rectified the situation quickly, but it was nonetheless uncomfortable. He made a good effort to work it out with us. I would recommend his place quite strongly, especially if you were looking for a stay like I described. The value was great, and the accommodations (except for the one mentioned) were very good. Thank you, Kevin. - Jesse

Kevin was an excellent host! Really made us feel right at home in Park Slope. He is very easy to talk to and his bonsai garden is beautiful. The room is really spacious and just as pictured. Would most definitely recommend staying here.

Kevin is a kind of host you'd love to have on airbnb. Open-minded, friendly, relaxed and welcoming, he made us feel immediately at home after a long  flight. The rented space is huge and very private, so don't be concerned for your privacy, it's like having a whole apartment for yourself. The house, the location, the ambience, all of them can't be beaten. Park Slope is truly the best place we've seen in the city (on par with Greenwich Village perhaps), and it's amazing to come home after a long Manhattan day. Or you'd like to have a walk through other great neighbourhoods right to the Brooklyn bridge, park, promenade, etc. If you're visiting NYC for the first time, start here to fall in love with this amazing city. Definitely recommended!

1. I spent 5 nights at Kevin's place.

2. Kevin's description of his apartment and of everything else was a complete truth.

3. Thanks to Kevin's great attitude and to the neighborhood in itself I felt really safe and comfortable in his apartment.

4. If and when I'm going back to NYC I don't know, but I do know to look again for Kevin's place.

Our stay at Kevin's home was our first Airbnb experience and everything we hoped for. I was here with my sister and my niece and we had enough room to move around and feel comfortable. It is a perfect place to come home to after visiting hectic Manhattan. We rented this place because we had a family wedding close to Kevin's house, but we definitely would come back here just for visiting New York. Park Slope is a great neighborhood, much quieter than Manhattan, but with everything you need just around the corner. We loved Prospect Park - a few blocks away -  at least as much as Central Park. Kevin is a great host, knowing how to balance personal contact as a host and the need for privacy of guests. He keeps the house clean and has clean towels and sheets at your disposition. If you plan to use the kitchen to cook your own meals, you should take into account that Kevin likes to have the kitchen for himself from 7pm-9pm. The kitchen has everything you need to make a good meal for yourself.
We definitely recommend Kevin's Airbnb!

Kevin is so welcoming and nice. He made us feel at home the moment we arrived. The two double beds are comfortable for 4 people and the shower was great. It's a 30-minute ride from Manhattan and the neighbourhood is safe and pretty.

Great place to stay, definitely recommend this.
Kevin is a great host. It was a good experience. Clean, Very safe neighbourhood, and subways are really close to the apartment. Had fun in NY and definitely recommend this place to live.
The location was great for us and Kevin provided a toddler mattress for our little one that worked out great.
He'nice and clean, friendly and accurate

A wonderful place by a wonderful host. Kevin made us feel at home the moment we got there. The place was clean and close to many restaurants and bars. A quick walk to the subway making that commute to the city very easy. I highly recommend this place.
We had a lovely stay and Kevin is a great guy! Nice neighborhood with many good restaurants, and close to many subways.

Kevin was a lovely guest. The rented space has two separate spaces (bedroom and living room), both spacious and comfortable. i went to work with a co-worker so we shared the space (one in each room) and it was very comfortable.
i already knew the neighbourhood (park slope) and it's a great place to stay, quiet, nice brooklin life with subway stops a few blocks away to reach manhattan or any other place with ease.
Kevin was thoughtful and always asked if we needed directions or anythings. We didn't have as much contact as i would wanted because we very working, but overall very warm stay overall, would visit again!
La estadía en general fue muy agradable, Es un barrio muy tranquilo y seguro, tienes transporte muy cerca bus o Subway. Todo fue excelente
Kevin is very accommodating; very accessible location.

Kevin's space was fantastic. It was in a great neighborhood everyone was friendly. It's near restaurants, grocery stores, laundry mats, you babe it. His place was great. Clean, spacious for four people,everything we needed. Kevin was also fantastic and was a great host! Hope to be coming back again!!

This was my first time using AirBnB and I was not sure what to expect. Kevin was very hospitable and available for whatever we needed. He was intentional and truly wanted to make sure we enjoyed our time in the city, however it was not overbearing. It may say you have a private room, however it feels as if you have the full apartment to yourself. The room is very large and such a great deal! The location truly gives you the true New York neighborhood feel without all the tourists. It has a bar district, cute market across the street, and many little boutiques. It is a quick walk to the subway which will take you into Manhattan in no time at all. I will definitely try to stay here next time in the city!

Kevin was very accommodating, hospitable, and gracious  with check in and check out times. Privacy was a premium and Kevin understands the balance between gracious host and respect for personal space. My three days in a fun  Brooklyn neighborhood living  in his house was a perfect fit. Thank You!
We enjoyed our stay in slope park. Thanks to Kevin for allowing our family to stay so close to where we needed to be!
Un lugar ideal para una pareja, cercano al metro, con un vecindario que da gusto recorrer. Muy agradable todo.

Kevin's place is in a great location in Park Slope, within walking distance to lots of things.  It was fun for us to be in a city neighborhood, since we live in a rural area where we have to drive everywhere.  The bedroom is nice and quiet, and was a good place for a family of 3 to stay.  Kevin is a welcoming host.
Kevin was a great host. The space was perfect for our family needs. Awesome location and as a first timer, the bar has been set high! Would definitely stay again!

Really enjoyed our stay.    It was nice to be so close to the sights of Manhattan and able to return this beautiful apartment in a lovely neighborhood.   Enjoyed strolling around the shops and restaurants as well as Prospect Park.  Kevin is an excellent host, going out of his way to make sure we were comfortable and enjoying our stay.
Kevin is a great host! Safe location. Great place to go with a couple of friends that want to enjoy the city. Super close to public transportation. Would stay here again!
Kevin is very hospitable.  Good communication.  Very responsive.  Place is near everything. Its like what you see on TV.

Kevin's place in a very good position, a very nice neighbourhood in Brooklyn and just few stops away from Manhattan. Kevin is a very careful host, making anything to make yourself feel comfortable and completely independent. 
We also tried the inflatable mattress and it's very comfortable and convenient. Definitely a place I'd recommend in NY.
Kevin was a friendly host and had great communication. His place is in the heart of Brooklyn with less than a 10 minute walk to the Barclay's Center. I would definitely recommend this AirBnb
Kevin was an amazing host and accommodating us with whatever we needed. He was very friendly and welcoming! The space was perfect, and the AC works great!!!!!

We had troubles with our plane, so we arrived a little bit late, but Kevin was so nice and he arranged to have his keys for us :) He replied to my messages immediately, wow. Everything was prepared for us, we felt at home. I recommend this guy :)

The space was perfect for the 3 kids and I. A bedroom and a very comfy air mattress for 2 of the kids to sleep on that tucked away nicely in the AM.  KItchen & bathroom to share with our host so we could have breakfast and/or lunch in house & snacks available for hungry teen boys.

The location was amazing for food, subway, shops, walking, Prospect park, getting to Manhattan, and my favorite: friendly AM coffee at the corner store with nice people to chat with!

Kevin was a gift!  When we arrived he was on the street to greet us and give us all big welcome hugs. Could not have asked for a nicer man, easier to get along with, and helpful with our questions. Big hugs when we left too. 

If I go back to Brooklyn... this IS where we will stay.

Loved the Bonsai gardens.

This place is awesome! Wonderful neighborhood, super safe, tons of restaurants and bars, and extremely clean. Kevin was very accommodating and after we experienced park slope, my friends and I are entertaining the idea of making a move from Kentucky to the area. This was a great deal and the perfect place to start your exploration of the real New York!
Appartement bien situé pour se déplacer ensuite sur NewYork et ses environs. Pizza Roma tout a côté nos a bien ravitaillé sans nous pendre la tête
Very cosy place and Kevin is very friendly host. recommended to everyone

Nice location where close to explore many places in Brooklyn.  Big space and feel like home. Kevin is one of the best host who you count on him.  The House itself is safe and in best hands which you couldn’t ask for more.

This is the second time I used AirBnB in New York, and it's much much better than the first time! The place is very clean, and Kevin made sure we had everything needed. The location is convenient too, which only takes 20-25 min to reach lower manhattan on a N/Q/B train. (Don't take R since it's local and much slower.) My husband and I were traveling with my parents, so the bedroom + living room settings were perfect. You can shut the door to the bedroom and they turn into two bedrooms. I was a little worried about the air mattress in the living room, but it's actually much more comfortable than expected since it's a raised airbed. You might want to put a blanket on top of the airbed before lying down in winter if you prefer sleeping warm. Otherwise it's great. Kevin and his apartment definitely set a high bar for my AirBnb experience. I would stay there every time when I visit NYC in the future if possible :)
Muy atento y servicial, totalmente de acuerdo con lo publicado. Nos atendió muy bien, muy cuidado el departamento, nos ayudaba a referencias hacia donde ir o como movernos.

Kevin's place was a great location and great value for this weekend's trip to the city. He was a friendly and helpful host and made us feel at home. The space was laid back and the neighborhood very welcoming. Also, there's a great corner cafe at the end of the block.

Kevin has been so nice with us! His place is very comfortable. We were able for have a big room just for us and we could enjoy it without problems. He absolutely respected our own space, also he helped us with any thing we need. My friends and me felt very safe in that area of Brooklyn. Is so friendly, close to a lot of nice places and the subway as well. I recommend it, and the price for it is perfect.
Kevin a été compréhensif des changements sur le’ nombre de personnes et s’est adapté: merci.
The space was exactly as advertised. Great location, clean and a friendly host. Will be back!
Thanks for a wonderful stay in Brooklyn!
Kevin is easy to talk to, and is interesting.  Enjoyed the stay!

Kevin was a terrific host - very communicative and with a deep knowledge of the neighborhood. Lots of space in the awesome apartment, and no more than a few minutes walk to some great food and drink, as well as public transportation and one of the biggest parks in the city. I really enjoyed my stay. Highly recommended.
Nice brownstone in great part of Brooklyn.

We are family of four, stayed at Kevin's place for 3 nights. Kevin was a very nice guy and fun to talk to. Wish we could have more time to interact with Kevin but we had too many things to do in NY! Metro stations are a block or a few blocks away depending on which line you take. There are markets a block of walk away but we were stunned by the selection available at Fairway Market which is about 5 km away where we saw so many products we've never seen in where we live. We just jogged to the market with one backpack so we could not bring back as much as we wanted. Street parking will be a challenge as the space is pretty limited but you don't really need a car if you are heading to Manhattan, just use metro.
Perfect location

Kevin is a soft-spoken and nice man who checks with his guests about their needs. His place is very convenient as it is surrounded by shops, interesting eateries and supermarkets. Also, Kevin tries to stay out of the way of his guests so that they feel they have space to relax. The armchairs in the living room are very comfortable. There are enough power points and they are at easily accessible spots. Kevin's passion is bonsai and he has a backyard full of them.
Great location. Amazing bars within walking distance. Phenomenal neighborhood. Great host

If you’re looking for the perfect apartment in the perfect location with the perfect host you have found it. 
A beautiful apartment, spotlessly clean, quiet and private but with the friendliest most helpful host. Kevin, thank you again. This is what air Bnb should be all about. Also great value and great communication too. Five star and then some
Good. Location. Nice place. Kevin was a great communicator to get me checked in and settled. Would definitely stay there again.
Kevin was a great host! He was kind and knowledgeable on where to go in NYC. Lots of space in the apartment with a nice, quiet location. Highly recommended.

We really enjoyed our time at Kevin's. His apartment is located in a lovely neighborhood where we enjoyed multiple bars and restaurants. It was really easy to transit from his place to everywhere in New York City. Thanks again Kevin !
Nice place and Kevin was great. Friendly. Neighborhood was safe with good food in the area. We needed space to be near family in the area and it really worked out nicely for us.

Kevin's place is quiet and well located in Brooklyn with nice shops/restaurants around, underground lines in walkable distance; good to go toward Manhattan (~15 /20min). 
Kevin is a great host, nice to talk with.
A great location from which to be a part of New York.
Nothing fancy, but if you're looking for a place to stay in a great location with attentive host, Kevin is your guy. Everything is as advertised.
Excellent location and communicative host!

Kevin is a great host - a super host, really! I felt so comfortable staying in his home. There is so much space and the bed is comfortable, too. The bathroom was never blocked, I had it for myself. Everything was very clean! The neighborhood is amazing, there is everything you need as well as subway stations. I could highly recommend staying in Kevin‘s house. It was perfect!
Kevin’s place was clean and as-advertised. He was a friendly and helpful host, and we had a great stay!
Great localization  and great host!!!

Kevin’s place offers many great things but I will highlight LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!!! Park slope is a great, safe location and many options for subway lines to manhattan are within a short walk. The rooms are as advertised. We had 3 people so we did use the air mattress, which is a very comfortable double high mattress. Kevin was very hospitable and kind. We highly recommend this great alternative to staying at a hotel.

Kevin’s place was a home away from home. I came to Brooklyn a second time this year and this marked my first Airbnb experience in NY. It was exactly as I envisioned. Kevin’s hospitality, advice and understanding made the stay memorable. I’ll always recommend his place to those searching for a place in NY.

This is a great place to stay.  Kevin was super easy to work with and helpful. I had enough privacy but also some great interaction to get tips and advice.  Spot is the ideal place in Brooklyn. Near several subway lines, Prospect Park, restaurants, and cool shopping. 

Would definitely recommend and hope to return.
We had a great stay at Kevin’s! He was easily accessible, quick to respond, and very helpful and flexible. Highly recommended!
Great place and a great price!
Great place. Great location. Great host!

host.host_location: Rio de Janeiro, State of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

address.street: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

reviews.comments: Limpeza insatisfatória, Gas do chuveiro desregulado, wifi ruim , ar condicionado soltando água em toda a sacada, quarto muito pequeno

O apartamento é bem como as fotos mostram!
Tudo bem limpo!
Chuveiro super bom!
E cozinha com todos os utensílios necessários!

El alojamiento es un apart hotel, que tiene vigilancia y recepción las 24Hs. Las instalaciones compartidas (pileta, etc.) estaban en perfecto estado. La ubicación es excelente, frente al mar y a 10 min de shoppings en Uber.
Respecto del departamento, la limpieza fue excelente (limpiaban diariamente) y muy atentos. Las fotos describen perfectamente el departamento, que tiene una hermosa vista al mar.
Habría que mejorar el servicio de wifi (No se podía usar Instagram o Netflix con regularidad) y el equipamiento (mesas de luz, espejo). De todas maneras nos sentimos muy cómodos, gracias.
El departamento tiene una vista espectacular a la playa y la zona es muy segura, hay facilidad de transporte público.

Decepção total: o mobiliário é velho, pobre e desconfortável, com 2 sofás sebosos e 1 mesa pequena com 4 cadeiras. TV a cabo falha pelo menos uma vez ao dia. Inexiste a TV no quarto exibida nas fotos. As cortinas-velhas, empoeiradas e quebradas-não tem utilidade nem para inibir a forte luz dos postes da rua. O Wi-Fi de 1 mega, totalmente ineficaz: não é o padrão do prédio, pois todos os outros apartamentos têm 10 mega, conforme informações do próprio Condominio. Os lençóis e toalhas, de péssima qualidade, em 4 conjuntos, 2 conjuntos com apenas 1 fronha, 3 conjuntos sem elásticos para prender no colchão. Os pratos, talheres e panelas, também de péssima qualidade, parecem restos de louças, com xícaras sem pires e asas para segurar. Panelas velhíssimas e nojentas! Uma total falta de atenção em agradar os hóspedes!!
Departamento en el puesto 7 de barra de tijuca, queda muy lejos del centro de barra pero tiene un súper a unas pocas cuadras y es frente al mar. Muy cómodo

name: Apê completo, amplo e charmoso em Botafogo
summary: Amplo apartamento de 3 quartos com dois banheiros. Duas camas de casal e um sofá cama para dois solteiros. Sala e cozinha integradas - TV a cabo e wifi - Ar condicionado em todos os cômodos. A 15 minutos a pé do metrô e Lagoa - Ao lado da Cobal do Humaitá - Serviços e restaurantes no entorno. Possibilidade de colchão extra no quarto.

host.host_about: Jovem jornalista que adora viajar com seu marido, seu bebê e seu cachorro. Carioca, pode dar boas dicas de como se divertir no Rio de Janeiro, das praias desertas aos programas alternativos.

address.street: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

reviews.comments: O apartamento é excelente, as fotos são totalmente fiéis ao local. Grande, arejado e muito bem localizado com ônibus para todas as regiões e próximo pra ir de táxi para os pontos mais procurados do rio. Pra completar a anfitriã é generosa e me deixou dicas da cidade e de transporte. Quando voltar ao rio é nesse apartamento que pretendo ficar novamente.

O lugar é legal e super seguro, mesmo para caminhar de noite. Fica perto de restaurantes e mercados. 
A Clarice e sua mãe foram muito cordiais e prestativas, além de atenciosas.
Nos sentimos em casa, bem aconchegante.
A casa tem muita cultura, e um ar diferente.

name: Cosmopolitan Brownstone Sanctuary
space: Gorgeous classic Brownstone Duplex on one of the best blocks of Brooklyn's hottest neighborhood. This house has been meticulously and lovingly restored by its owners, who just relocated overseas. Amazing high ceilings, beautiful hand carved moldings and brand new modern kitchen and bathrooms (2 full bathrooms plus washer/dryer). Huge private garden (shared with downstairs tenant who hardly ever uses it). Spacious 2 bedrooms function like 4: L-shaped Master Bedroom has pull out double couch that can be separated from the main bed area with Japanese screen; also upstairs is a 2nd large bedroom. Downstairs is an enormous living area  that can be divided off to create a separate bedroom area as well as ample living space with large TV and cable; plus formal dining room and fully stocked kitchen. Especially great space for extended families. Location is literally at the epicenter of Stuyvesant Heights/Bed Stuy's culinary and cultural life - within 2 blocks are the neighborhood's best restau
description: Gorgeous classic Brownstone Duplex on one of the best blocks of Brooklyn's hottest neighborhood. This house has been meticulously and lovingly restored by its owners, who just relocated overseas. Amazing high ceilings, beautiful hand carved moldings and brand new modern kitchen and bathrooms (2 full bathrooms plus washer/dryer). Huge private garden (shared with downstairs tenant who hardly ever uses it). Spacious 2 bedrooms function like 4: L-shaped Master Bedroom has pull out double couch that can be separated from the main bed area with Japanese screen; also upstairs is a 2nd large bedroom. Downstairs is an enormous living area  that can be divided off to create a separate bedroom area as well as ample living space with large TV and cable; plus formal dining room and fully stocked kitchen. Especially great space for extended families. Location is literally at the epicenter of Stuyvesant Heights/Bed Stuy's culinary and cultural life - within 2 blocks are the neighborhood's best restau
house_rules: Our main concern is consideration for our downstairs tenant. This is a strictly non-smoking property, including on the back deck/back yard. Noise must be kept down from 10 PM to 10 AM especially on the downstairs floor. Trash and recycling must be managed as explained in the house guide.

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about:
Hello and welcome to our home!

We're Stelian, Deanna, Hudson and Hazel. We've traveled extensively as a family and enjoyed staying in short-term rentals throughout Europe and the States, often finding it to be the most comfortable and interesting approach. When the opportunity came up for us to move abroad again, we decided to share our home in Brooklyn with other families and travelers. We've put a lot of thought and hard work into our home, starting with a fairly dilapidated brownstone and restoring as much of its historical grandeur as possible, while incorporating modern amenities. 

We've entrusted Jessica and her team to manage our property while we're away and hope you enjoy your stay!

reviews.comments: The second my co workers arrived to launch our business in the east coast, Adina was there to greet us! Stelian & Deanna's home was cozy and felt like a home away from home. Adina was a great and very helpful hostess. She answered all our questions and was very available by cell. Thank you for making our experience in NYC a memorable one.

Some might say it's the real deal - a grand, traditional brownstone apartment in Brooklyn. We very much enjoyed our stay here. The flat was spacious, well-equipped and spotlessly clean. There was plenty of space for our family of 5 as one of the bedrooms has a 2 double beds and lots of storage space. Adina was our host who was extremly efficient and helpful. She even went to the trouble of buying us a DVD player whilst we were there as the apartment didn't have one. The neighbourhood is what could be described as up and coming. It has pockets of gentrification but still is very much a regular, vibrant area which we enjoyed. As we have young children we weren't often out late at night but I'd say there are probably safer areas (but definitely many that would be more dangerous!) It's close to the speedy subway express subway line A. We went to Manhatten most days but did visit the excellent Children's Museum, Prospect Park etc in Brooklyn. Can recommend a special doughnut bakery called Dough....

It was a perfect house for two couples. We had all the privacy we needed  (big bedrooms, two bathrooms).  Subway to the city is near, just a short walk. Although the neighborhood is still developing, it is safe and very quite, which was so nice when you come back from loud city. You can hear birds singing in the morning and we even had squirrels visiting back yard :)
We had excellent communication with our host.
I would recommend this to people who love peaceful place to stay while visiting NYC.

We had a wonderful stay, the house is a magnificent place to stay, spotlessly clean and well equipped. The kids had all the space they needed to play around. It was sometimes difficult to find some parking place around the house, but we always managed in the end. Area is rather authentic, some streets around seems quite rough, but we never felt unsecure, and Macon st itself is beautiful and very peaceful. Brian and Adina were very nice and helpful, and welcomed us warmly. Great place for family!

My family absolutely loved their stay here. The brownstone was beautiful and most importantly very clean. Just as nice as the photos. They were really helpful with getting everything set up as my family decided to come at the last minute. Very good communicators and nice people. My parents are already looking forward to their next visit. Have already recommended to other people.

Adina and Brian are very good hosts, we are a family of 8 persons with a baby and we spent 8 nights in New York, we got very good memories, we really liked the house, the subway is 5 minutes and there are restaurants nearby very nice.
The photos are identical to the house.
Bian Adina thank you very much and have been very happy in New York

We had a great experience staying at this place. The brownstone is big and well stocked-just as advertised. We visited NY with another family, and there was plenty of room in the house for everyone. The house was clean and ready when we arrived. The kitchen had enough dishes and cooking gear for a good size group. There is plenty of street parking, if you are travelling by car. The subway is about 7-10 minute walking distance, which is very convenient. There is also a cool back-yard, but we had too much fun in the city and did not have time to use it.  The area, which is predominantly African American, was perfectly safe.

The only downside, is that the neighborhood can get loud at night, but this is New York, after all. 

We had a great stay in New York and are very grateful that we had a chance to stay at this house.

This is a super place to relax in when staying in NYC. It is beautiful and is well equipped. We were a group of two families and it was perfect. There are lovely bars and restaurants closeby and it's close to the subway. Brian met us and showed us around the house. He was great too. I can't wait to return.

We enjoyed our Brooklyn stay very much!  Our hosts,  Stelian & Deanna Dragan - Retzer, provided great accommodations for us, including apply food for our first breakfasts. We found the City easily accessible from our location, as were groceries and good restaurants.

Coming in as a traveling circus for the Fringe Festival  Stelian & Deanna's beautiful brownstone provided us a wonderful place to retreat to away from the hustle of Manhattan. Six of us were very comfortable in their home and could easily find our own nook to nestle in if we needed solitude. 
The neighborhood is lively and charming with plenty of hidden gems to seek out for food - Peaches, Bedford Hill, Scratch, Saraghina, The Pantry, just to name a few - and has managed to resist the gentrification that has swallowed the intimacy of many other Brooklyn neighborhoods. The home also has a great kitchen and lovely back yard if you choose to prepare your own food.
Traveling to and from the brownstone, be it to Manhattan or through the neighborhood, I always felt safe and secure.
Adina and Hayley, who helped to manage our stay in Stelian & Deanna's absence, were always attentive, helpful and kind.
I highly recommend this brownstone to all and hope to return soon.

The place is as cute as the pictures, very comfy and spacious it feels like home. We enjoyed having a place like this to come back to at the end of each crazy New York day. We had clean towels and sheets upon our arrival. It had all the comforts of home including movies, to choose from for a relaxing evening or rainy day and excellent wifi. The kitchen is nicely equipped for cooking needs as well, although there are places nearby that have some pretty good food. We highly recommend this place and would stay here again.

This is a Great place to stay while in NY!! There were 5 of us staying there and we had more than enough room. I loved the fact that we had a bathroom with counter space vs. a tiny pedestal sink. All rooms are very spacious!! Loved the architecture and hard wood floors.Brian met us there and took great care of us! He was an awesome host. We had a small maintenance issue during our stay and he came over right away and took care of it. It was very hot while we were there  and the window units kept us plenty cool. We walked to the small grocery store around the corner a couple of times and also enjoyed the italian restaurant Brian recommended.The only downer for us was we had my elderly mom with us who doesn't do too  well with stairs and the bathrooms are all on the 2nd level. A little challenging for her, but not the rest of us. I would definitely stay here again and  highly recommend to others. You won't be disapointed!!

It is a beautiful appartment with plenty of space, light and comfort. I enjoyed getting to know Brooklyn but the commute to work in midtown Manhattan took quite some time (45/50 minutes). The neighbourhood is mainly residential and some distance from the more lively areas further north and west. Adina and her team were welcoming.

This is an absolutely BEAUTIFUL brownstone in the heart of Brooklyn. Spacious, clean and perfect for families and/or groups of friends to stay for an extended period of time. Adina, Brian and Jessica were extremely courteous and checked in with us numerous times during and after our stay. Once we arrived, Brian even hung around for a while to share with us local restaurants and grocery stores we'd like to visit while staying there. I highly recommend this location and working with this team. I appreciate their service and the hospitality they showed our family.

The Brownstone is in good shape, has a few modern updates and is situated in a residential area with some good local restaurants close by.  Our experiences at Peaches (both of them) and Saraghina were great. The main floor kitchen, dining and living areas are well situated and well stocked with condiments and the little things to assist with home cooked meals.  The main bath was nicely appointed and the laundry worked well.  We had some issues with the alarm system that was resolved by Brian. He was kind enough to bring over some fruit and original NY bagels and cream cheese for us to try when he came to assist. The neighborhood seems safe, with friendly folks on the street at all hours, coming and going but as another reviewer said can be a bit noisy at times.  The A-C Subway lines provided reliable  transportation and were about a 10 minute walk to Utica Av station. We used the 7 day unlimited Metro card to go all over not just Manhattan. No car is required to get around.  Adina and her group were very accommodating and had also arranged our airport pickup for us. Overall, don't expect the Fairmont Plaza experience but this is a nice place to stay in Brooklyn.
Great place! Very much enjoyed our stay!

I can't say enough good things about this spot or Adina, the lovely woman who manages the property.  We are a local family who needed temporary housing at the VERY last minute and Adina was so helpful and gracious.  The property itself is charming, well stocked, quiet and one block away from our very favorite Brooklyn restaurant, Saranghina.  Communication was effortless and the one tiny issue we had (we just preferred the hot water a little hotter) was resolved instantaneously.  I swear she had a plumber there within five minutes!  Highest possible recommendation!

The appartment was very comfortable with  everything we need there.The bed in the second bedroom was not terribly comfortable and too narrow for two people. The main bed in the master bedroom had a ?plastic cover on the matress which is not great. The area is interesting and quite close to subway stations. however it is a subway ride to the more interesting and hip areas in Brooklyn which are wonderful to browse around.

The Brownstone is really a nice place to stay in Brooklyn. It is spacious for a family of four, clean and comfortably equipped, exactly as on the photos shown. It's a ten minutes walk to the A (express) line to Manhattan and it takes about 25 min. to Central Park from Utica Avenue.
There are supermarkets, groceries and restaurants nearby (we can recommend "Bread Love", Stuyvesant Av. 375; they offer breakfest, a small variety of lunch and dinner, also for take-away, fair prices, and the cookies were the best we've ever eaten ...)
Adina arranged our airport pickup which was also very comfortable if you are the first time in NYC (although the brownstone is easily to reach from JFK with airtrain and line A). Eddie was a very nice driver and showed us the house.
We highly recommend this place and are looking forward to coming back again !

We had a lovely time at the cosmopolitan brownstone sanctuary . We were four people and had more than enough room . Adina was lovely , we could ask her all the time when we  had any questions . We can recommend this place without no doubt . We would love to come back.
Very central location in Bed-Stuy, with the neighborhood's best spots easily within walking distance.  Spacious home and very responsive property manager.

L'alloggio di Stelian & Deanna è proprio come appare nelle foto. Ampio, molto suggestivo per gli interni che lasciano trasparire la sua storia. Molto luminoso grazie alle tante finestre presenti. Bellissimo camminare sul parquet che scricchiola ad ogni passo.
Noi abbiamo alloggiato a Giugno, il tempo è stato abbastanza instabile ma non abbiamo patito il caldo, è facile creare corrente in casa.
La fermata della metropolitana (Kingston Throop Avs) è a meno di 10 minuti da casa. Vi ferma la linea C local.
Dall'aeroporto JFK l'appartamento può essere raggiunto in taxi oppure con il bus che ferma a pochi metri da casa (noi l'abbiamo usato quando siamo ripartiti, ci impiega circa 45/50 minuti e si può usare la metrocard).
Non abbiamo incontrato direttamente Adina, ma all'arrivo è venuto ad accoglierci Lester, molto gentile e disponibile per informazioni e suggerimenti.
Il quartiere è sicuro, ci siamo sempre mossi in tranquillità anche la sera. Consiglio colazione da Brunswick cafè, cena da Peaches, Saraghina o Beso. Da Beso ottimo anche il brunch.
La nostra esperienza è stata molto positiva. Pernottare a Manhattan, quando si visita New York, è molto comodo perché si riducono i tempi trascorsi in metro ed è più facile passare da casa, ma Brooklyn è un'ottima soluzione per spendere un po' meno e avere spazi decisamente più ampi.
In casa c'è wi-fi. Peccato che nelle camere sopra il segnale sia molto debole, ma basta avvicinarsi alle scale per connettersi facilmente.
L'unica vera difficoltà l'abbiamo avuta con il lucchetto con le chiavi, per noi è stato impossibile aprirlo.
Ovviamente consiglierò l'appartamento a chi mi chiederà suggerimenti per pernottare a New York.

We stayed at Macon Street for two weeks in June and we loved it. We chose this house specifically because it had enough room for 4 people. We were not disappointed! There was more than enough space and privacy for two couples. Besides that it's a lovely house with lots of character. We really felt at home here and it was wonderful to relax on the soft sofa after a long day in the city. 

We really loved the neighborhood, there were all kinds of great places to eat and hang out. You'll find them all on Adina's Map of Brooklyn that's in the apartment. We liked Saraghina the best, but we also loved Peaches! One addition to the list is Brunswick, around the corner and great for breakfast and lunch. 

Transportation to Manhattan was very easy: with the A Train it's a 15 minute ride to downtown. But we also really loved Brooklyn and Bed Stuy in particular! For at least 5 days we didn't even go to Manhattan. 

If we would have to name one down side to this place it would be that the bar around the corner sometimes plays loud music (only in the weekend at night, but until late). Other than that, we were very happy and Adina and her team responded quickly to our minor issues (putting the A/C units in when we asked). 

We hope to visit again some day!

We had a very good week at your house, thank you! The house is very comfortable, nicely located and convenient for subway. High ceiling makes the house very airy and roomy. Although some hitches with the wifi system but all very happy and left with a good memory. Highly recommended.
From the Ling family

Hello everyone.. we've been hosted by Stelian from july 26 to august 14 this year in Macon Street. 
Bed - Stuy  neighborhood of  is  strange place to live and to visit. 
is basically a neighborhood in evolution. in our block of Macon street there were few abandoned houses close to houses super cool. 
To get downtown (Brooklyn / Manhattan) you have to take the B26  bus for 4 stops and then the subway (A express or C local not so huge differences) . 
in 45 minutes you can go anywhere in Manhattan. 
The only real problem is that it is not logistically affordable to return home in the afternoon and then go back to the city in the evening. so be prepared remaining in the neighb or not come back home before nightfall. 

Plus : great area, nice people (African Americans, Africans and Latinos different), some very nice cafes and restaurants. 
Minus: very few shops in the area except Norstrand / Fulton st. but a lot of Deli's 24h (all quite similar). 


The house: 
the house is terrific. Convenient, comfortable, really nice. It seems everything is still up to the early twenties .. the wooden staircase, parquet, the two very large bedrooms, double living room and kitchen. 
all really nice. 
If I can find some small minus (otherwise what review would be ??), I'd give a general refresher with particular attention to the handles of the rooms and the doors frame

Wifi. I think that is the biggest issue now for all the guest of Airbnb. Internet at home has its hub in the basement and then in the rooms of the second floor is not so good.  

Host: we had a small problem with the shower and Stelian took immediately care of it.. and sent us a caretaker (great guy) to fix it. 
instead, The mysterious Adina managed all the stuff (check in check out ect.. by email and phone, and has proved to be very efficient. 
Thanks again for everything. 

we had a really great time in Bed-Stuy

We stayed here with other family members for our daughter's wedding.  What a perfect place for our family!  Spacious, airy, tastefully decorated and comfortable.  We felt at home sitting around the dining room table with our coffee in the morning.  Of course, a walk to Andres-George's coffee shop was another option.  Fantastic chocolate almond pastries!
We contacted Adina a week before arrival to make sure everything was in order.  She answered her phone promptly which assured us we would be able to contact her in NY if needed.
Check in was simple.  The lock box was very easy.  Parking required a pass around the block looking for a space, but not a problem.  Note that garbage pickup requires moving your car to one side of the street on some weekday mornings.  Apparently locals simply double park, but something you might want to check on.
The house is beautifully maintained.  Simple furnishings, bright, airy and clean.  We couldn't have been more pleased.  New kitchen and bath renovations were an added bonus.  A lovely backyard we did not make use of...perhaps next time.
Great restaurants.  Saraghina's and Peaches we highly recommend.  A corner grocery for any small necessities.
We were aware of the the possible loud music around the corner on the weekends from a previous review.  It was loud, but the new windows and doors were pretty good at deadening the noise.  
We thoroughly enjoyed walking around the neighborhood and taking advantage of the fabulous food and architecture.  A delightful stay.  We hope to visit again!

We had a great time here. Wonderful and clean house in a very quiet but well equipped area, close to Manhattan via A and C subway lines.. all the photos can't describe its beauty! The choice to stay in Stelian & Deanna's house made our experience in NYC unforgettable and unique. Special thanks to Jessica for her kindness and prompt help.

What a great place! Close to the express subway and just around the corner from good cafes, restaurants, and bars. Spacious, clean, and quiet. Very cute backyard. And a renovation job that's the perfect combination of modern (bathroom and kitchen) and original-detail classic. I wish we could have stayed longer!

All was fine at this brownstone house. Jessica cared about everything, once we left a message. (It would be good to have a working cell phone number, Jess, just in case of...).
Nice people in the neighborhood, stores, restaurants and café in walking distance. 
We were 5 people, not all family, and it was good to have the 2 bathrooms. Kitchen well equipped, and lots of space in this apartment. 
Would rent again, and can only recommend!

Six of us stayed in this charming apartment for 4 days. It was clean and spacious. There were plenty of clean linens and towels to accommodate all of us. Having a kitchen and a place to do laundry was also convenient. The commute to Manhattan was easy - just a short walk and a 20 minute or so train ride. The hosts were incredibly responsive to all of our needs and answered our phone calls immediately when we had a couple of questions. This was a much better alternative than an over priced hotel in the city. I would definitely stay here again!

We had a fantastic time at this property in Bed Stuy. Jessica was the most helpful host in the owners absence. Jessica was easy to get hold of and responded extremely quickly to any of our queries.

The place was immaculate and a very large living space for the 8 of us that visited. It was only a couple of blocks to the express train meaning it was only 20 minutes traveling time for us to get to and from Manhattan.

We can only recommend the place as we had a wonderful stay.

Thank you for having us!

We loved it in Bed Stuy! Our host Jessica was really helpful and answered all our questions. It's a beautiful house, the photos are true! Bed Stuy is a 'rough diamond'. There is a mix of class and culture but we found everyone polite and welcoming.

Stelian and Deanna's home was large, warm and welcoming and very clean, which really impressed me (being a fusspot).
  
Jessica, who manages the property, was super efficient and helpful, and when we had a minor problem in one of the bathrooms, it was fixed immediately and efficiently.  
Stelian was also very helpful and patient when I had to call him when we arrived in Brooklyn in regard to directions, etc.

Once we know about the key in the lockbox it was easy to use, although the locks were a bit tricky to negotiate at first, especially with one of the key sets.

We are so pleased that we decided to stay in this area of Brooklyn and got the chance to stay in this gorgeous, majestic and large brownstone.

We look forward to coming back in the warmer months - the snow outside was very pretty but oh so cold...

We had a wonderful stay at Cosmopolitan Brownstone! A family of five with three teenagers enjoyed every minute of this beautiful spacious place. Jessica our property manager was very service minded, helping us out when needed, making everything at the best. The apartment is well equipped, clean and nicely furnished. Especially happy about kitchen and bathroom facilities having a big family. 

This Brooklyn home enlarged our NY experience with it's charming atmosphere, easy to get by, only 20 minutes away from Manhattan with the A train. For sure a place we will recommend to friends who would like to have a convenient and genuin NY experience. 
Thanks again Stelian and Deanna, if me may we'd be happy to return any day! 

Poa and Henrik Samuelberg
Stockholm, Sweden

Stelian and Deanna's lovely property is spacious, and very clean! We felt right at home.  Jessica, who cares for the brownstone, was very helpful, both before our stay(e-mailing back and forth with us) and during our stay(being available by phone for a few questions). 
The only negative point, that we felt, was the neighborhood. The website sites the property to being "on one of the best blocks of Brooklyn's hottest neighborhoods.". We didn't find it to be so.

The home was tastefully designed and decorated, the kitchen well equipped with cooking necessities and plenty of towels and blankets. Their caretaker Jessica was very responsive to our needs. There are a few restaurants and stores around, but not as much as the bustling Bushwick area right above Bed-Stuy. With their beautiful backyard and high ceiling, this home is very well suited for families/groups that want a calm and relaxing stay.

Stelian and Deanna accepted a last minute reservation for my family over the holidays after we had another airbnb host canceled our original reservation in New York. It is difficult to find a home in New York City that is comfortable for 7 people and this was simply perfect. Everyone had a comfortable place to sleep, and the kitchen and dining area allowed us to cook and eat together. We had to travel a bit to get to our favorite restaurants, cafes, and attractions but it was worth it to be able to have a space that was beautiful and comfortable for all of us. Thank you Stelian and Deanna!

We stayed in Stelian & Deannas beautiful home for over a month and loved every single day of it! The area is fantastic with lovely small shops and restaurants and the apartment was perfect. Large and with an amazing atmosphere. We were well taken care of with fast feedback on any questions we had. Definitely recommend this place!
This was the second time we stayed at this amazing place and we loved it! The area is getting more lush and beautiful for every day and I can't recommend this place enough.

The house is amazing, full of character and quirks. I stayed for a month and it truly felt like home by the end. The area is well worth exploring, sadly I had injured my ankle so was limited to just the immediate neighborhood. However there are still some great places a few mins walk from the front door; an interesting Wine shop, many great restaurants, and places to drink.
Thanks for letting me stay

I highly recommend this place for all families and big parties!  This house is very spacious and big enough to house my entire family.  The description and pictures are very accurate, and Jessica was very accommodating to any of our needs.  Thank you for making our NYC trip amazing!

We had a great stay. Beautiful house, awesome backyard, nice neighborhood and the host was extremely responsive and took care of us. Small things like plenty of towels too -- which goes a long way. Also the place was VERY clean unlike other AirBnBs we've stayed in. Would love to stay there again.

We had very wonderful experience living as a local Brooklyn at S&D's House. The house is old as all other historical Brownstone houses in Brooklyn, but having well mataince with nice little garden! Will stay there again if we had any chance to come back!
Spacious clean place, great for families. We really enjoyed staying there and made good use of that backyard!
Great stay! Amazing space with so much history. Ample beds and great space for a large party or family with kids. (they have books and toys for kids to play with)

We (4 couples) stayed 6 nights in this nice house in Brooklyn.

The neighborhood is nice and safe, with everything you need : bars, restaurants, bike rental and grocery shops. It is rather close to the subway that gets directly to Manhattan. We spent most of the days outside and basicly just slept there, but we certainly enjoyed the large living area and the garden.

We didn't use it much (except for morning tea/coffee), but the house has a proper kitchen that can be handful if you want to prepare lunch or dinner. We also liked the 2 bathrooms that made easy for 8 people to get ready in the morning!

When booking, we didn't notice that one of the beds would be an air mattress (it is only mentioned "3 beds" but nothing about the 4th) and it deflated during the first night. Jessica (the appartment manager) replaced it right away the next day and we didn't have more troubles after that.

Overall, we had a great time at the appartment . Jessica was easy to reach, friendly and attentive.

What a beautiful comfortable home in Brooklyn. Residential neighborhood close to the subway. The kitchen has all that you need for preparing meals even though we only cooked breakfast and snacks. Having 2 baths was a real bonus. Our hosts were in contact to assist in anyway and that felt very comforting. Can't wait to come back!

My friends and I had an absolutely fantastic time at S&D's home over the NYE holiday season.  The place is a 10 minute walk to the A train, which brings you into midtown in ~25 minutes. This made transportation that much easier.

We weren't in contact with S&D too much, but the property manager, Jess, was super responsive with communication and helped us check-in.

The house comes equipped with a lot of extras, dishes, spices, glasses, cooking supplies, towels, toiletries, that really helped if anybody were to forget to bring something.  This made the stay that much more comfortable.

If you're larger group of people is looking to stay in a large, comfortable brownstone apartment in the heart of Bed-Stuy this should be high up on your list.  

Thanks S&D!
Communication was great. House was spacious, beautifully maintained, even better than the photos. All in all, a highly personalized, special experience.

A casa é conforme estão nas fotos e ficamos bem acomodados (2 casais). O Metrô é perto e a vizinhança tranquila. O custo/benefício foi muito bom. A gerente Jessica foi bastante prestativa e gentil. Apenas estranhei um pouco o barulho ao andar sobre o assoalho de madeira.
The host canceled this reservation 20 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Stelian & Deanna's place is a wonderful and spacious house! It's totally equipped, rooms are huge, the main bathroom is also fantastic. There was a wardrobe full of clean towels and sheets for us to self-serve. Internet works reliably. Heating system is flawless. Communication is super responsive and they were always standing by in case we needed help with anything. A great temporary home for your NY stay!

Great experience. The house is just as beautiful as it looks in the pictures, and has everything you need for a very comfortable stay. Lots of space, enough for our group of five adults. Two bathrooms, which is an absolute plus, if you are staying with more than two people. The house is situated in a safe and quiet neighbourhood, walking distance to the closest A-train station: 10 minutes, which makes it easy to go to Manhattan as well as to JFK-airport. Lots of parking space in front of the house, if you arrive by car.
Bars and restaurants are right around the corner, make sure to check out „Zaka“ for great breakfast, lunch or dinner, just across the street on Garvey boulevard, which opened the week before we arrived. Great food, lovely staff, brilliant chef.
Communication was excellent, we had one or two questions, that were answered immediately. Check in was smooth and easy, check out very generous, as we were allowed to keep our luggage in the house, until we had to go to the airport.
It was a perfect stay, highly recommendable, would definitely return, if we came to NYC again.

A very beautiful and clean home. The pictures are accurate. We didn’t have much communication with the hosts during our stay (wasn’t required). However,  they are extremely particular about their home so if you have young children or are looking for a homey experience this may not be the place for you. It’s more like staying in a museum- security guards included. They sent us a bill after checkout for over 2,000 dollars and said they would send another related to steaming their sofa and other activities related to what we consider routine cleaning after guest departures. The tenant downstairs is also pretty uptight. That said, it’s a spacious and clean house but not suitable for young families or anyone not up for walking around on eggshells.
The pictures do not do the place justice. Plenty of space and great location!

The place is lovely and very spacious, just as you can see in pictures. The neighborhood is very beautiful and I felt very safe. I walked at night from the subway alone and it was OK. Also, it is 10 minutes away from the subway, but it's like 45 min from Manhattan (trains can take their time to get to the station and you have to consider rush hours, delays, etc), so it may be exhausting sometimes, specially if you walk a lot during the day and then want to get out at night! And Stelian and Deanna were very nice (we didn't meet them), they helped us with our questions and doubts very soon.
The place was clean and safe, good amenities. Could be nice if some areas were refurbished.
Great place to stay always!
Loved the house; it was beautiful and well-positioned for exploration. Had a great time and would definitely stay again.
amazing property!

La casa di Stelian & Deanna è davvero bella e accogliente. Spazi ampi, doppi servizi, lenzuola e asciugamani per ogni ospite. Le camere sono ampie e confortevoli. La linea locale della metropolitana (la C) è da pochi minuti di strada a piedi dall'appartamento. Il treno diretto invece (linea A -  UTICA) è a circa 15 min a piedi, un po' più lontano rispetto alla linea locale, ma comunque raggiungibile con una breve passeggiata. Il tragitto da casa a Manhattan è un po' lunghetto, e varia dalla mezz'ora ai 45 min, a seconda di dove si deve andare, senza contare il tempo per raggiungere la fermata. 
Le distanze da percorrere sono davvero ampie! 
la cucina è completa di tutto, micro onde, forno, fornelli, stoviglie e lavastoviglie. Solo la dotazione di pentole è davvero scarsa. 
Si effettua la raccolta differenziata. Nei dintorni della casa ci sono supermercati e alcuni ristoranti. L'host mette a disposizione degli ospiti, un fascicolo con tutte le informazioni necessarie, davvero completo!
Se cercate un posto tranquillo dove rifugiarvi la sera dopo esservi tuffati nella folla della grande mela, la casa di Stelian & Deanna è l'ideale. ottima anche per famiglie con bambini (anche piccoli: la scala che porta alle camere da letto è dotata di cancelletto di sicurezza per i bimbi)
Very nice great location and spacious room for us

name: Erskineville Private Room Queen Bed
summary: I love my apartment, I offer a private room in my apartment. It is light & airy, and a very comfortable space, it has a well equipped kitchen, large bathroom, and a great Balcony.   The location is Erskineville, a village atmosphere with fantastic restaurants and cafes. Newtown restaurant and shopping precinct is 10 mins walk.  Close to Technology Park, Sydney University & Carriage works.
space: My Asian inspired Apartment, will offer you a nice comfortable feeling in a great location. You will sleep in the Main Bedroom that is lockable if you choose. Bigger space than you expect, with the freedom to enjoy solitude or share space and hospitality.
description: I love my apartment, I offer a private room in my apartment. It is light & airy, and a very comfortable space, it has a well equipped kitchen, large bathroom, and a great Balcony.   The location is Erskineville, a village atmosphere with fantastic restaurants and cafes. Newtown restaurant and shopping precinct is 10 mins walk.  Close to Technology Park, Sydney University & Carriage works. My Asian inspired Apartment, will offer you a nice comfortable feeling in a great location. You will sleep in the Main Bedroom that is lockable if you choose. Bigger space than you expect, with the freedom to enjoy solitude or share space and hospitality. There is access to all areas kitchen, loungeroom, dining room bathroom &  laundry of the Apartment. The 2nd Bedroom is off limits. There is a Balcony & BBQ for you to enjoy. I will be happy to show you around if you like, sharing meals can always be fun. Introduce you to my favourite Bars & Cafes. I am also able to leave you to enjoy the experience o
neighborhood_overview: Erskineville is a very sought after area close to the City. The neighbourhood is a mix of colourful friendly people.  A very friendly village, that has a great community feel.  A place where the locals like to buy local and support the businesses on the strip.
notes: You can use my kitchen to cook if you choose to, my kitchen is very well equipped as I love to cook.
transit: Close to Railway & Bus stations, Airport, Beaches, City & Parks. I can provide a Bicycle if you like also. Walking distance to City, University Technology Centre, Carriage works, Railway Stations, Shopping, Restaurants, Bars & Cafes
access: There is access to all areas kitchen, loungeroom, dining room bathroom &  laundry of the Apartment. The 2nd Bedroom is off limits. There is a Balcony & BBQ for you to enjoy.
interaction: I will be happy to show you around if you like, sharing meals can always be fun. Introduce you to my favourite Bars & Cafes. I am also able to leave you to enjoy the experience on your own.  You are the decision maker.
house_rules: We will be sharing the space, so I expect you to respect me and my place. Excessive alcohol and loud behaviour is not tolerated. Drug use will not be tolerated. Smoking outside is ok but not inside. No pets allowed.

host.host_about:
I am a women aged in my 50's, who likes to travel, wine & dine, and just love to be around people from all walks of life.
I love different cultures.
I teach Karate and I also do Remedial Massage. 
I love to read, mix with my friends and my grown up daughters. I am happy being near the ocean and listening to the waves.

reviews.comments: The host canceled this reservation 56 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
That room is good. Those two night was comfortable. Profect breakfast.Sorry my english is not good. I just want to say she is a nice lady. Maybe next time I will choose this room
Gayles place is like her, amazing place amazing person. So relaxed and laid back. Thanks

Gayle is the best host you ever can imagine. She is incredibly kind, caring and easy going person who makes you feel like home. The apartment is nice, clean and tidy, and just a few minutes from the city centre. I would highly recommend Gayle's place for everyone!
Gayle was a great host. Easy to communicate with and very informative. The room was great n the bed was comfy. Thanks heaps Gayle

It was perfect!!! Gayle it was like family for me! She helps me a lot, and we had a good terrace conversation together.
It's the best place where you can sleep if you go to Sydney!
Thank you for all Gayle!!!!

Wow... EXCELLENT indeed. From the moment I stepped in. I felt completely welcomed. The host is excellent, great and very respectful. Really excellent always. The host told me I have unlimited supply to towels. I felt home. I can use everything in the kitchen. Very clean. This is something you will notice. The place is really clean. Clear instruction.  I was offered to use the washing machine. There is a natural feeling of feeling comfy there. The area is great. It is close to Newtown walking distance. Few minutes from train station. 
Train is 5 to 10 minutes from Central station in Sydney. Once you're in Central station you're in the city and you can walk around. 
A++++ Would love to revisit someday. Excellent!
The host canceled this reservation 25 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

5 minutes to railway station 
Hostess very nice 
Very clean tidy and comfortable
Gayle is a very nice lady.my mum can't speaks too much English.but she speaks very slowly and clearly.thank you for all the time and give my mum a wonderful Sydney accommodation experience.

The apartment is really good located (5' from the train station). Gayle is the perfect host: friendly, helpful and able to make you feel at home. She also allowed me to leave my luggage in her apartment for 1week after my check-out. Thanks Gayle! 
Hope to se you again :)

Really nice place. Gayle is very friendly and kind. I rented a bedroom in her house for almost two months and she gave me a ride to a supermarket and to the airport once. The apartment is really close to the bus stop and train station as well as restaurants and supermarkets (Woolworths is like 10 min walk). There is a set of stairs to get to the apartment. The place has one A/C in the common area and each room has a ceiling fan. 
While the apartment in general is clean, I did find two spiders during my stay. The apartment also has another room (her room) which she also rents in Airbnb. The only thing I would improve would be communication since some of the times I didn't know there were other guests staying in her room and would find strangers in the apartment without a notice that if I saw other people inside the apartment it was okay because they were guests (eventually she tells you but sometimes its after you see the other guests). 
We cooked for each other and had a lovely dinner! 
Thanks again for having me Gayle :)
Thank you Gayle, I enjoyed my stay at your place. Excellent communication too

name: Private room in Hell's Kitchen ( for 1 person )
summary: This cozy private room is one block away from a subway station. Experience the city that never sleeps and enjoy vibrant restaurants that Hell's Kitchen has to offer. You can simply walk to Times Square, Broadway shows, Lincoln Center and Central Park. We will be out town on Jan 23th-24th. So, please do not book any instant booking during that time and contact us first.
space: A private room in three bedroom apartment in the heart of Manhattan with one bathroom and 24/7 access. This furnished private bedroom with full size bed and wifi is ideal for tourist, conference participant and business trip. You'll be sharing the apartment with our sister, Fame, and another airbnb guest(s).   The apartment is located only one flight of stairs above the street (no elevator).  It is the perfect location for people who are visiting NYC: It is steps away from 42nd street and Times Square, the Theater Districe, Restaurant Row, etc. 1 block from the subway and couldn't be easier to get anywhere in NYC. The apartment has a fully equipped eat-in kitchen which you are welcome to use to prepare and store your food. There is a shower and a tub for bathing.
description: This cozy private room is one block away from a subway station. Experience the city that never sleeps and enjoy vibrant restaurants that Hell's Kitchen has to offer. You can simply walk to Times Square, Broadway shows, Lincoln Center and Central Park. We will be out town on Jan 23th-24th. So, please do not book any instant booking during that time and contact us first. A private room in three bedroom apartment in the heart of Manhattan with one bathroom and 24/7 access. This furnished private bedroom with full size bed and wifi is ideal for tourist, conference participant and business trip. You'll be sharing the apartment with our sister, Fame, and another airbnb guest(s).   The apartment is located only one flight of stairs above the street (no elevator).  It is the perfect location for people who are visiting NYC: It is steps away from 42nd street and Times Square, the Theater Districe, Restaurant Row, etc. 1 block from the subway and couldn't be easier to get anywhere in NYC. The ap
neighborhood_overview: - One block away from a subway station, getting around in NYC couldn't get easier.  - Walking distance to Central Park, Columbus Circle, Times Square and MoMA - Great selection of bars and restaurants just steps from your door - This is a true Manhattan experience
notes: Check in time: 3pm Check out time: 12pm
transit: 5 minutes walk to the nearest subway station. Getting around NYC couldn't get easier.
access: Guest have access to private bedroom, as well as shared kitchen and bathroom.
interaction: We have busy schedule from time to time but totally welcome to have a casual talk if the schedule allows us.
house_rules: - Keep it clean like your own place - No parties - No pets - No smoking inside the apartment - No overnight guests - Please don't stay in the bathroom longer than 30 minutes

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about: I'm a New York-based creative technologist and game designer, originally from Bangkok.

reviews.comments: This place was very central. Thanks Reed!
Reed was great and the location was perfect!

I've stayed at the room for 16 nights. Reed and his sister were the best hosts! They almost immediately answer my needs, gave recommendations, etc. They made me feel at home right from the start.
The room was very clean, not very spacious but it's everything a person travelling alone would ask for: comfortable bed, hot shower, cheap price, and the possibility to cook (if you're on a budget this is great). And location! Location just cannot be beaten! Look no further, this is your room at NYC!

Excellent host!!! Reed was very kind and friendly and was always available replying emails.  His flexibility on the check in and check out was primordial for me because of my flight timing.  The location of his apartment was perfect and it is only 5 minutes from Times Square and very close to 5th Ave.  I highly recommend Reed as a host!!!

The room is pretty much as described. The place is quite convenient. It is near to the Times Square, Broadway and sub station. One thing I was not quite comfortable is the toilet. It's too small and compacted.
