You can walk to everything - cafe's, restaurants, supermarket and the bus stop that can take you everywhere else.  Of course glorious Bondi Beach is just a minute away on foot. Either head to the end of the point and jump in off the rocks or walk to the sand and plunge in. It is beyond heavenly.
transit: The bus stop is a 3 minute walk away and can get you to nearby Bondi Junction for some hard core retailing / cinemas. From there trains can get you into down town Sydney, circular quay, harbour bridge, Opera House. There is also a bus service from up the road all the way into the city - no train required.
access: It's all yours!
interaction: We will be available during your trip if you need anything!
house_rules: Please use the space as you would your own place! No smoking and be sensitive to our neighbours.

host.host_location: Bondi Beach, New South Wales, Australia
host.host_about:
My wife and I have 2 kids 16 & 13. We moved home to Bondi Beach after 10 years running our company, gDiapers in Portland, Oregon. 

We have a ton of fun running the business which allows us to travel to the US, Canada, UK, France, Germany and Spain. 

I enjoy running marathons eating Indian and Thai food and the odd movie. 

We love using AirB&B to get a different take on the cities we visit and as host want to reciprocate after fantastic experiences in Rome, LA, New York and London.

reviews.comments:
Awesome place!
Unfortunately I couldn't meet Jason. He was on vacation, so his friend Stu hosted us. He was just on time when we checked in & out, and very friendly. 
House is just like in the pictures. Nice living room with wide open terrace. The one of the best thing is there is a small park where you can oversee the Bondi beach in just 50m away. Also around 5min walking distance to beach.
The main room has double bed and empty drawers to keep things. And second room has 2 bed and 1 bed-like shelf.
There is no A/C (small room has small one, bue can cover the whole house), but in day you can open window. there is breeze so it is not so hot. In night, each room has fan, so no need for AC.
There is laundry room with laundry machine and dryer. Bondi beach is quite more humid than Sydney. so it was very convenient.
I'll definitely visit again with my family someday. This is perfect place for family. I so envy Jason to live this house:)

Jason's place was exceptional! Our hosts were able to meet us at check-in, and getting to know them briefly was fantastic. Their home is welcoming, as is Bondi Beach. The flat is walking distance from groceries, restaurants, and of course, the bus. We were comfortable with the assurance that when coming home after long days in the city, we would have anything we needed and a quiet place to rest up for the next big day out. Bondi is a wonderful community - staying here, I think we saw the best side of Sydney.

Jason's place is such a gem! We loved staying here. It's the perfect spot in North Bondi and we felt at home right away.  It has plenty of space and a great kitchen if you choose to make breakfast and lunch at home as we did. And the neighbors are very friendly. I highly recommend this spot.
Amazing location with access to everything we needed, super comfortable space. We'd definitely recommend this place!

name: Lovely, Cozy Loft Carroll Gardens
summary: Well airconditioned loft right in the middle of the most desirable neighborhoods in Brooklyn: Carroll Gardens, Park Slope, Boerum Hill and Gowanus. 10 min walk away from BAM. And a quick train ride to Manhattan.
space: 500 square foot loft in arts enclave in Gowanus, Brooklyn. Freshly renovated entirely private apartment with separate entrance, full kitchen, living room and bedroom alcove, which allows for privacy. The two single beds in the sleeping area are  set side by side with one comforter to make a up a king sized bed. The fold out couch can be made up to a full sized bed upon request for a fee of $25. Charmingly decorated with much love; new, clean appliances; and some select vintage furniture. Newly renovated bathroom, with WC separated by an extra door and luxuriously spacious shower. Large windows with a far view of Brooklyn's skyline floods the apartment with light. Central heating provides cozy, even warmth throughout the winter old out couch can be made up to a full sized bed upon request for a fee of $25. Airconditioning keeps things cool in the summer.  For those traveling with small children: We can provide crib and/or pack and play.  Close to R train (Union Street) and F and G (Carr
description: Well airconditioned loft right in the middle of the most desirable neighborhoods in Brooklyn: Carroll Gardens, Park Slope, Boerum Hill and Gowanus. 10 min walk away from BAM. And a quick train ride to Manhattan. 500 square foot loft in arts enclave in Gowanus, Brooklyn. Freshly renovated entirely private apartment with separate entrance, full kitchen, living room and bedroom alcove, which allows for privacy. The two single beds in the sleeping area are  set side by side with one comforter to make a up a king sized bed. The fold out couch can be made up to a full sized bed upon request for a fee of $25. Charmingly decorated with much love; new, clean appliances; and some select vintage furniture. Newly renovated bathroom, with WC separated by an extra door and luxuriously spacious shower. Large windows with a far view of Brooklyn's skyline floods the apartment with light. Central heating provides cozy, even warmth throughout the winter old out couch can be made up to a full sized bed up
neighborhood_overview: Gowanus is the new go to neighborhood in Brooklyn, right in between Park Slope and Carroll Gardens full of new restaurants and atractions, including the Gowanus Souvenir Shop which we own.
transit: There are a number of subway stations close by that will take you to Manhattan quickly. The R Train is 5 min away, union street stop. The G and F train are a 10 min walk to Smith Street, the stop is called Carroll Street stop
access: We live right next door and will let you in personally and show you around.
interaction: We live right next door so I am always available to help with any questions you might have.
house_rules: This is our home. Please treated like you would treat your own home. No extra guests past 10 pm or for overnight without checking with us first. Not suitable for gatherings or events.

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about: I am originally from Germany and moved from Berlin to New York, working here in the arts for over 7 years now. I love the city, and Brooklyn is the best. I moved to Gowanus from Williamsburg for the variety of the different neighborhoods here (elegant residential and old school industrial without the massive crowds).

reviews.comments: Host was very communicative and informative. The place was great, really neat and cool. The neighborhood was a lovely little pocket in Brooklyn.
The accommodation was perfect: conveniently located, clean, spacious and even with a far view of the skyline! Ute was very kind and helpful throughout the process.
Ute was very warm and made the whole process very easy. The apartment was exactly as described, clean, and cozy. I had a wonderful trip!! Loved the space and the neighborhood.

Ute kindly offered me a bigger place. It is is rare to find such a lovely big place in the heart of New York. It has an artistic touch and I just loved it! The host was also very kind and helpful offering us maps and all we needed.

This could not have been a better experience. Ute was a perfect host and made the experience super easy. Everything worked and all the ins and outs of staying there were succinctly explained. 

The loft is exactly as pictured and is a wonderful place to stay. It didn't take very long for it to feel like a home away from home and I will be recommending it to anyone I know visiting NYC and especially Brooklyn. The neighborhood is cozy and a short walk/train to just about anywhere you'd want to go without being loud at night.

Esperienza assolutamente positiva. L'appartamento era pulito ed ordinato. C'è tutto ciò di cui uno ha bisogno. La comunicazione con Ute è stata perfetta. Piacevole scoperta il quartiere dove si trova, c'è davvero tutto. A pochi isolati di distanza c'è la metro, il supermercato aperto 24 ore su 24, il parco con i giochi per i bambini.

Ute's boyfriend was welcoming and was there to show us around.  I met Ute on the street just before we left and we had a friendly conversation.  The neighborhood was great -- one of Ute's neighbors helped us and told us everyone on the block knew one another and were friendly.  The apartment was spacious and clean.  It was near our son's apartment in Cobble Hill.

Het appartement was erg prettig, ruim en van alle gemakken voorzien. We vonden het best fijn om niet midden in Manhatten te verblijven, om zo ook wat meer van Brooklyn mee te maken en toch ook wat rustiger te kunnen slapen. Het contact met Ute verliep erg soepel. De buurt voelde erg veilig aan. De metro is erg dichtbij.

El apto.luce como en la foto. Las camas son cómodas, con sábanas y almohadas suaves.Está agradablemente decorado.
Tiene la cocina bien equipada como para preparar alimentos básicos.El baño espacioso y tiene agua caliente.
El vecindario es tranquilo.Nos sentiamos seguras.
Lo haría perfecto unas cortinas en las ventanas y un pequeño microondas.
Ute fue muy amable y prudente. Lo recomiendo!

El departamento es igual que en las fotos. Muy bonito y cómodo. Ute es muy preocupada por todo. Nos hizo sentir acompañados.
El lugar está cercano a una avenida importante con metro. Tiene muchos lugares para comer, tomar un trago, escuchar jazz, etc. 
Caminando se puede conocer otros barrios de Brooklyn, con historia. Tiene un gran parque cerca.

Ute's loft was just as described and shown in the pictures - and we really loved staying there! She welcomed us as soon as we arrived at her place. It was easy to comminucate with her during the whole stay. The neighborhood is pretty cool with a lot of graffiti art, vintage stores & lovely restaurants. Getting to Manhattan with the subway is no big deal - just at night (after partying for example) it's a bit more difficult, because the subway runs a bit irregular. So taking a taxi, uber or lift is a lot more convenient at that time.

What a great apartment, and what great people! I arrived in a downpour, walking about 10 blocks from a friend's place -- Joel was patient while I waited out the worst of the storm, and then met me at the corner with an extra umbrella. The apartment is just about the Brooklyn-est place in the world -- the cold concrete floors were a) much appreciated in a heatwave, and b) covered with area rugs, which made everything feel warm and homey. And the A/C worked astoundingly well. You can't beat the location (super close to the R train and practically next door to Ample Hills ice cream!)... I can't imagine why anyone WOULDN'T want to stay here.
Tout etait niquel proche du metro qui emmene directement à manhatan

A nice apartment.  It is clean and comfortable.  Be aware that you must climb two long flights of stairs, but being in New York is a good workout in itself.  Joel promptly answered any texts we sent asking about directions.  Look around this neighborhood.  Lots of good places to eat.  Right around the corner is Runner and Stone for your breakfast.  Don't miss it.  Nice view of the city.

Todo fue perfecto, Ute es un gran anfitrión, siempre estuvo en contacto con nosotros. El departamento es muy lindo y es tal cual aparece en la foto. Esta a unas 3 cuadras del subte de la línea R que va muy rápido a Manhattan. 
Esta a 3 cuadras de la 5th llena de lugares para comer.
También está a la vuelta de un restaurante que se llama Dino en donde comimos muy rico.
It was our first time using Airbnb. Ute was a wonderful host. She was always helpful and responded very quickly. The location is nice and close to metro stations (F and R Line).
Ute was great! Very communicative and helpful. The neighborhood was friendly, we all felt very safe, and the apartment was really adorable. Highly recommended!

Ute's place is in a fantastic location. There are tons of restaurants and attractions within walking distance, and everything else is a short uber ride away. The apartment is exactly as pictured: clean, spacious and furnished with all of the basics. The bed is really firm so if you like something softer, I recommend ordering a memory foam topper or something through Amazon (which is what I did). Communication was quick and easy. The street parking is available but not necessarily easy. You may have to park a few blocks away depending on the time of day. All in all, Ute's place is a great value in Brooklyn!
Great Brooklyn stay at Ute's cozy apartment. Ute was very friendly and communicative. Well-designed and comfortable space. Convenient Brooklyn location. Simply a nice stay!

A great space in a great location. The apartment was clean, comfortable, and full of lovely little touches that created a sense of warmth and welcome. Ute was there to great us when we arrived, and made check-out very easy.

We really enjoyed our stay. The apt. is decorated very tastefully and we loved our time there. Our hosts were flexible and met us when we arrived. We want to come back and appreciated the warmth of the place.
Ute is a great host, very responsive; the loft is nice and cozy, it's well equipped, and it's in a nice and well connected location, great if you want to spend time in Brooklyn.

We spent a week at Ute's appartment and really enjoyed it. The appartment is cozy and has all the amenities you would normally need. 

Ute was a responsive host and provided us with good directions to the appartment. Once we got there, Ute's boyfriend Joel gave us the keys and some tips and info about the neighborhood and we were all set. Ute and Joel live next door so if you need any info etc. they are there to help.

The neighborhood is very interesting with lots of new restaurants around. Definitely way different than busy Manhattan full of tourists. If you are looking for a good place to explore Brooklyn, this is it.

Ute was so kind and communicative enough. The apt profile was full of details about surroundings to visit (sadly we couldn't visit her shop ;( ) . 
You have everything you need to stay totally comfortable on your visit.
Absolutely recommended.

This is a fabulous location. Great restaurants, shops, scenery in the neighborhood!!! The apartment is spacious for 2 people, possibly a family with small children.  Great views of Brooklyn and Manhattan.  Family friendly. Close to subway (2 blocks, 5 minute walk).  Ute is an awesome host.  Definitely will stay again!! Stayed in 5 different Airbnb's in Brooklyn in the last 4 years, this was by far the best.

Without a doubt, this has been one of my most favorite places I've stayed for a vacation. It was lovely, beautiful, simple, looked just like the photos, and is perfect for a solo traveler (as I was), or for a couple. It truly felt like a home-away-from-home. Don't be fooled by the industrial look of the area—I felt safe during my whole stay. I loved how it felt like a hidden home. The location was convenient to the subway, markets, restaurants, and parks.  Ute was very kind, relaxed, and welcoming. I can't express enough how much I enjoyed my time in her home and am so glad that this Airbnb was where I stayed for my first visit to NYC and Brooklyn. For as long as she will offer this place as an Airbnb, this will be my #1 lodging choice for the area! Definitely would stay here again, in a heartbeat!
Lovely space and very gracious host. Worked well for my baby and I and was within walking distance to park slope.

The appartement is perfectly located in Brooklyn close to the subway station to go to Manhattan and the airport. It was clean and everything we needed was available. A welcoming host and the arrangement for the keys went fluently. We definitely recommend this place.

This is a great location in an industrial/ post-industrial up and coming artists loft neighborhood where Gowanus meets Carroll Gardens. It was a perfect 5 minute walk to where I was working, and a short distance from many delightful Brooklyn neighborhoods, restaurants, shops, etc. It was quiet, private and roomy, with great light and gorgeous views of the Brooklyn skyline. Also, I was very warm and comfortable, nice new mattress, great shower, and most of the desired amenities..., including a DVD player with a nice selection, area rugs, a comfortable bed (firm new mattress)

Ute is lovely, don't miss her "Gowanus Souvenir Shop" around the corner.

Great apartment - just as described in advert.
Ute was a great host throughout the booking and stay. She went above and beyond when we were stuck in New York due to cancelled flights making sure we were okay. Thank you!

Lovely apartment in an unassuming building in a super cool area of Brooklyn. We loved wandering around the local area for drinks, food and shopping, and a pretty easy walk to Brooklyn Heights/DUMBO and across the Brooklyn bridge to Manhattan. Make sure to head up to Prospect Park too.

Ute's place was just as advertised.  It is in an unusual neighborhood that is transitioning from industrial to upscale.  However, it is within walking distance of lots of good things (including where our daughter and her family live).  We would stay there again.

Het verblijf is op zich prima. Alles wat nodig is is aanwezig.
Locatie is nogal industrieel maar voelt veilig aan.
Openbaar vervoer is prima beloopbaar

This Brooklyn space was perfect for us. A short 2 block walk to the R train into Manhatten and close to many restaurants and bars to choose from. We especially liked the Vintage clothing store down street (great bargains)
Very light and spacious, comfortable place to stay. Many shops, restaurants, bars in easy walking distance, and close to subway. Ute was flexible about checking in and out. I would stay again.

The apartment is very comfortable and cozy. It has everything you need for a great stay. You really feel at home here. The wifi connection is excelent. Ute lives next door and although you don't see her much, she is easily reachable. 
The surrondings are also great for exploring Brooklyn. Plus, it's also well connected to Manhattan with many subway lines not far from the appartment. The area has a lot to offer and the apartment has great views from Brooklyn's downtown.
We will repeat our stay here if we ever come back to New York.
Highly recommended!

We loved our stay at Ute's apartment! She was very accommodating to our check in & out schedule. The apartment was clean, comfortable, spacious, and had all we could ever need! We enjoyed checking out local cafes, Ute's Gowanus Souvenir Shop, and shopping at the Whole Foods nearby to have food on hand. We spent most of our time in Manhattan, seeing the sights, but also loved the local feel of Brooklyn. It's about 2 blocks to walk to the Subway and a short ride into the city from there. Such a great first Airbnb experience to go along with a great first trip to NYC! Definitely recommend!

Ute's place was a perfect home away from home for me for the week. It was my first time in NYC but everything was so easy, from checking in to catching the subway to different locations around town. At first I thought the neighbourhood seemed a bit weird, but it's actually pretty nice when you get used to it. Would definitely recommend :)
Ute's place is very clean and comfy. It is in a safe neighborhood and it's within walking distance to the subway and lots of shops and restaurants.

Ute was very kind and sweet.
great neighbor.

I couldn't get over how great the room was.  It had lots of Brooklyn character. 

The room is on a quiet street, but within walking distance to restaurants, shops, and bars. 

Ute was very responsive and helpful. Would love to stay here again!

I really like Ute's place.  I have stayed there twice.  I like the location.  Once you learn the subways, it is great.  I LOVE the eating options in Brooklyn!  There are fabulous restaurants and good markets nearby, if you want to cook.  
The neighborhood is artsy and safe.  The apartment is very clean.  
There is a lot to see and do in Brooklyn, but you are very conveniently located to the City as well.

Ute's home in Gowanus is beyond charming and in one of the best neighborhoods in brooklyn. It feels like real community and unless you have to, you wouldn't ever have to leave--great eats, drinks, parks, late night pizza, shops, etc. The apartment itself was immaculate and beautifully furnished with simple pieces. It wasn't a very hot week, so the window AC unit was the perfect amount of cool. Bed was cozy and the kitchen had all the basics although I certainly didn't cook there. Shower/bathroom was spotless, great water pressure and again just really simple. The profile is 100% accurate. In terms of a host review, Ute was professional, easy going, and very organized. She reached out in advance to give me check in information and happened to be traveling but set up a meet/greet with her partner Joel. Could not have been more smooth. I even forgot a few things and Ute reached out to me before I left town so I was able to come back and grab them! I hope to be able to come again, the location is amazing and the place so comfortable.
The apartment is calm and well located to the area of Caroll Garden, and look exactly like the pictures.

A fantastic place to stay conveniently located just a few blocks away from so much that you could want from a visit to Brooklyn. I visited for my sister's wedding and was a stone's throw away from the venue, the hotel, the rehearsal dinner, etc.

The street is quiet and tucked away from the main roads so you're guaranteed some peace after a long day. Not only that, but Ute keeps the place very clean, which makes the experience very comfortable.

I would absolutely recommend and would visit again if ever I need an AirBNB in Brooklyn.
It's an up & coming neighbourhood in Brooklyn. Walking distant from the train and food options. A great space that made me feel like I living in a loft and felt homey.

Great place, clean, great part of Brooklyn , and the host is reliable and friendly.

Caveats: Bring ear plugs and an eye mask, as there is a fair amount of noise and light in the morning. Also, not a good place if you plan on having people over at night, as the host (who lives next door) can hear and will ask you to keep it down. Lastly, the place is in Gowanus, not Carroll Gardens, but close to Carroll Gardens if you want to be able to walk there.
My parents stayed here a few days whilst visiting me. Was exactly as described and great views of Manhattan!

Super clean and in a great location for where our event was being held. Lots of very good restraunts in the area, and a Whole Foods if you'd like to eat at home. Ute was super friendly and provided clear simple instructions for our stay. We will be back!
Loved this place. Very clean and functional. Industrial vibe but close to great food, coffee, and subway. Great communication.

Great space close to plenty of bars and restaurants and only a short walk from the subway. Ute was also a great host and very accomodating with checking in and out which was very helpful for us due to a delayed flight and traffic!

Ute's place was absolutely perfect for our needs. We were headed to a wedding at 501 Union and needed a conveniently located place to stay that could accommodate a baby. Ute was very responsive and flexible with our check in time, and her place was neat and cozy. The neighborhood is quiet and residential and we were able to find parking with relative ease. Would definitely stay here again!
The place is as described. We (my twelve year old son and myself) loved staying there and would love to stay there again.

To begin with, Ute was very responsive to initial communication and questions which is such a key component of a great AirBnb stay.  She was also able to accommodate a slight change to our reservation which was much appreciated. The apartment itself is really nice, in a great Gowanus location. It's clean, exactly as described, and feels like a good value for the price.

We wouldn't hesitate to choose Ute's apartment again for an upcoming trip.

It’s a up and coming area. Quirky with excellent shops a short walk. Best ice cream just round the corner. Restaurant close is excellent. Over the weekend it was quiet. Had a lovely time host is very responsive to any issues or questions.

Ute was the perfect host. Great communications. Easy check in and check out. So personal but also felt very private. Amazing location. Everything you need for a great stay. Bed was comfy too. Highly recommend.

Ute's place was great. Check in was simple -- we picked up the keys from Ute, who was a block away. The apartment is on a quiet street with an industrial feel -- no shops on the street itself. Parking was abundant, and it's just a few blocks from some very trendy bars and restaurants. The apartment is a decent walk from public transportation, but the major subway hub in Brooklyn makes it convenient. The apartment is a loft-style apartment, up two flights of stairs. We stayed with our baby, and Ute provided a pack-and-play that was perfect for her. The kitchenette has the basics -- smaller (1/2 size) fridge, stove, hot pot for tea, French press coffee maker, etc. No dishwasher or microwave -- this isn't the place for cooking (but no need to cook in NYC). The bed was firm and comfortable, and the shower had great pressure. Everything was clean and neat. It's a great Brooklyn experience in a fascinating neighborhood that gives you a feel for Brooklyn's past and future.

The place was lovely and had nice homey touches throughout, matched the pictures exactly. We chose the area as friends live really close by. Feels very industrial and to our surprise, there is a really lovely restaurant on the corner called Freek's Mill that has recently opened - really nice food and vibe. Smith Street very close, for more great places to eat and drink. Also worth heading towards Union St station and have some Polish dumplings at Baba's Pierogies! The only tiny downside, since we agreed to pay $50 extra for a second sofa-fold-out bed to be made up, we found that wasn't done when we arrived and had to remind our host. However, it was quickly made up after we headed out after arrival. Very recommended!
Schöne Wohnung mit tollem Blick in spannender Gegend!
No frills, but location makes this place. Host was friendly and responsive.

We have mixed feeling about Ute's place. There are some cons that heavily affected our stay.
PROS: Good location and close to the subway. Not the prettiest neighborhood in Brooklyn, but it's relatively safe and there are some new and interesting eateries. Comfortable bed, one of the best we've had in an airbnb. Without asking, Ute told us that we could have a late check out, allowing us to leave at 1:00pm because she didn't have any guests after us. She quickly accommodated our requests to raise or lower the heat, which she controls from her side of the building.
CONS: When we arrived, Ute greeted us to show the apartment, and there where bags of garbage just outside the door to the unit. She threw them away right after. The apartment is on top of a mechanic garage so it was very loud during work hours (beginning at 8am), and the space quickly filled with a strong engine exhaust odor. The heater made a strong gasoline-like smell, which made sleep difficult and breathing uncomfortable. The apartment appeared clean but the second day we found a cockroach in the bathroom near the shower. Even though we didn't plan to cook, it was challenging to peel an apple because there weren't proper knives. In the kitchen both the sponge and dish towel were so dirty we didn't feel comfortable using them to clean dishes, so we bought our own. The bathroom towels were probably clean but very old and the lighter ones had dark stains. We also found stains on the bed sheets.

It was a pleasure staying at Ute’s apartment. It’s bigger than several of my NY friends’ one-bedroom homes! It has a great view of downtown Brooklyn and I was able to make breakfast in the kitchen. Ute was quick to respond to my questions and greeted me when I arrived. She told me a lot about the neighborhood, which is an interesting mixture of manufacturing and residential properties. My appointment was in Manhattan and the subway was a quick walk. On the way back, I took a different route and got to see a bit of Carroll Gardens. I was able to stay only one night and would stay here again on my next trip back.
Nice place close to everything. Ute is timely with her responses and seems very friendly from our brief interaction.
Ute is a fantastic and prompt host. The apt is in a great location next to great coffee shops, Whole Foods and restaurants. It was a great option for a business trip.

This is our second place staying at Ute's Airbnb. The neighborhood continues to change in interesting and fun ways -- more coffee shops, more bars, etc. Ute gave the apartment a nice upgrade with a high-powered space heater, new paint, etc. It's industrial -- the apartment is above a garage with two big flights of stairs. The bed and shower are terrific. The small kitchenette was all we needed, and Ute provided a pack-and-play for our 8-month old. We love this apartment and hope to return.

This is a great space! Just as pictured, clean, stylish, spacious, and comfortable. Great view of downtown BK skyline! Close to subway, Whole Foods Market, Park Slope and Carroll Gardens. Ute is very responsive and helpful. We had a wonderful stay and would recommend.
Ute es una anfitriona muy hospitalaria. Su departamento es muy comodo y luminoso.
Nice neighborhood, cool place, with very nice view.....can indeed recommend
Appartement lumineux, atypique et très agréable à vivre, literie parfaite! Situe juste à côté de l arrêt de métro Union Street à Brooklyn, j y retournerai!

Such a great experience, the apartment is perfect, comfy, clean, design and with a lot of space. The view is great and the area is full of cool places restaurant and bar. Ideal location for the metropolitan and we re glad to use the Citi bike as well. 
Thanks to Ute for everything.

My travel mate and I really enjoyed staying in the heart of Gowanus. While interesting to enter, the payoff of downtown Brooklyn views is sublime. We found the place clean, quiet, inviting and personal.  The location was also right up our alley: a really nice coffee shop on the corner and walking distance to interesting local restaurants, entertainment and breweries. Access to the train was also easy for trips into Manhattan. The host was very responsive and accommodating. Would definitely stay again.
Top Urlaub in einer Top Location in New York City!

Seriously, don’t look any further! I’ve done the research for you - I’m pretty sure I looked at every single Airbnb property and hotel in Brooklyn and Manhattan under USD 200/night, before determining that Ute’s was the best for our budget and for location, quietness, comfort, transport connections to JFK and Manhattan, and local amenities. There’s a reason this place has such good reviews. We stayed six nights at Ute’s and were really happy with our choice; check-in and communication with Ute was very easy, there was an A/C unit when needed, a serviceable kitchen, a good bathroom, comfortable and large bed, and good available storage space. The neighbourhood is really up and coming with great bars, cafes, shops, and restaurants in the area, and we liked that it was close to the R. There’s a Whole Foods close by (and an Associated Supermarket when you’re feeling less rich), a gym by Union St, and we also liked that Prospect Park was within jogging distance. Thanks Ute!

Bei Ute waren wir zum zweiten mal.Die Unterkunft ist einfach das was man sich in New York wünscht.Subway , Supermarkt ,Restaurant (Dinosaurier)alles in der Nähe.Ute ist super nett , man bekommt auch Tips und Erläuterungen die mit Geld nicht zu bezahlen sind.Unterkunft ist immer in einem sauberen Zustand. Und sogar bis hin zu Handtüchern ist alles vorhanden.Fahrt hin ,Ihr bereut es echt nicht.
Tolle Aussicht, ruhig, gute Infrastruktur in der Nähe!

Ute’s loft is in a great spot in Brooklyn, near wonderful restaurants, and convenient to Park Slope.  A street of artists and families.  The loft is spotless and comfortable, with a great view of downtown Brooklyn.  Check-in and check-out could not have been easier. Ute communicates reliably and swiftly, and she is a perfect host.  We will rent again when we next visit our children in Brooklyn.

Nous avons passé un séjour très agréable chez Ute. L’appartement est charmant et il ne manque rien. On se sent tout de suite chez nous. Le quartier est très calme et en même temps il y a tout ce qu’il faut. Des petits cafés sympas, une super friperie, la station de métro au bout de la rue. Je recommande vivement cet endroit.

This apartment is such a steal! Easy access to Park Slope and Carroll Gardens, plus just about any subway line you could need — all that AND you’re right around the corner from the best ice cream in Brooklyn (Ample Hills). The space is inviting and comfortable and the view is stunning. This was my second time staying at Ute’s place and I’d happily return.

The location was perfect for getting around Brooklyn. The house had what we needed for our extended weekend. Very clean and cool. We felt safe in the neighborhood. If I were to return to the Gowanus area I would definitely stay again. 

Things to note:
The bed is very hard (which may be your jam, but wasn’t ours).
If you need linens for pull out couch- be sure to request in advance.

I booked Ute's place for my parents, during their visit from California. Ute was so helpful and responsive throughout the entire process, and met me and my parents when they were checking in. She explained everything in great detail and assured us that we could reach out if we needed any help. Her place is exactly as explained and photographed in photos, with a little extra charm! Freek's Mill, a Michelin starred restaurant is located right at the corner, and one of my favorite breweries is just a few blocks away. A really great place in an awesome neighborhood!
It was in a nice location, plenty of space, easy to check in with Ute. We also had a quick walk to catch the trains. Only downfall was no blinds, making it hard to sleep in during the mornings.
Great stay! Will be back!

We appreciated our stay at Ute's place. The flat is large and well equipped, very quiet, at 10 min from Caroll's garden by walk. Communication with Ute was great and she did best to provide solutions at our arrival.
The place was great and Ute was very nice! Totally recommend.
Nice location in Brooklyn.

Gorgeous location, fantastic hospitality and a really very stylish apartment. Perfect for our trip, with the host more than willing to be flexible with arrival times and communication was quick and personal. All photos are completely true to the apartment, and most amenities are provided.

The area is friendly and vibrant with everything that downtown Brooklyn does best (bars, markets, vintage stores - Ample Hills Creamery round the corner does the wildest ice cream!). Great base for those who want to enjoy the full New York experience and also the growing community in Brooklyn itself.

Real Brooklyn/New York experience. As for every major city, we strongly suggest you keep your suitcases off the floor and zipped up. Note there are steep steps to climb to access the flat, not accessible for less mobile people...also difficult on Tuesdays if you have a car - and yes, you will be ticketed if you don't find alternatives. Grocery in the whole area is really expensive, so come prepared if you are travelling from within the US. If from outside - restaurants will surprisingly be easier on the wallet.
The apartment is really nice and Ute is reactive and helpful. I do recommand this location if you want to stay in Brooklyn
Great host. Cool building. Nice apartment.

Ute's place is spacious and complete, yet sparse -  a nice complement to the neighborhood.  Everything was clean and orderly, warm and comfy.  There's a bookshelf full of both tourist and literature book by the couch and I found myself reading a field guide of birds in NYC area parks in the mornings., sipping coffee from the french press there.

The photos capture the place well and the neighborhood is fantastic.  Lot's of good food, art and bars nearby.  It is a warehouse / light industrial area with mixed use so expect weekday morning noise and activity, but nothing that woke us or kept us up.  Easy access to Manhattan, though the R train seemed to be frequently delayed during out time in the area.

Ute was easy to contact and responsive which made coming and going simple. 

Thanks and look forward to the next excuse to come out that way.
Appartement dans quartier industriel et artistique proche commerce et métro Un autre New-York très peu  touristique! Parfait avec un ado

Lovely, stylish apartment in nice area, close to subway. We wished we’d had more time to explore the Gowanus area, but location was great for city. Ute is super helpful and her place is well-equipped and spacious. I could have chilled there for a month! (Great books too!)

This loft is in the perfect location. Close to restaurants (we suggest the tapas bar Blueprint, that was our favorite and only 10 minute walk away!) and the loft itself is extremely charming. Ute was a great host and our stay was as comfortable as could be. Would return!

We were in town for a conference and we loved our stay in Ute's space! It was perfect, clean and comfortable. Great location with great little restaurants and bars a few blocks in walking distance. I would definitely recommend Ute's spot for friends visiting in the future.

We rented Ute's apartment and larger loft to host our wedding this past weekend. Ute was super easy to work and communicate with and even allowed us access a bit early to take measurements for our event. She was very clear about what was and was not permitted and followed through on everything we discussed. Overall it was a very positive experience and ended up being the perfect venue to host our big day!

Ute is wonderfully welcoming, helpful and congenial, and it was extremely easy to check-in.  The apartment is bright and cozy. Ute’s place was quiet, spacious and very clean.  The apartment is up two flights of industrial stairs which could be daunting to anyone with limited mobility.
Well-placed good-quality accommodation in a renewing former industrial area of Brooklyn with excellent facilities nearby.
super easy check-in process, great communication, awesome location, looks just like the photos. thanks for a great stay, ute!
It was exactly what I needed while staying in Brooklyn for a wedding. Stylish safe loft, easy communication, close to the train. Would definitely recommend!

This loft is a cosy and nice place to stay when visiting New York. On a small but spacy place, you find all the comfort you need: bathroom with shower and kitchen are well equipped, the beds sleep comfortable. A tasteful interior with a nice view on the Brooklyn skyline.  Close to subway stations with trains in all directions. Easy to reach by public transport when coming from JFK Airport as well. Enjoyable in every way!
Perfect place, and wonderful hospitality. Thank you, Ute!
Light, clean, great communication. Everything as expected and pictured. You can see the city scape in the distance.
Ute’s space was amazing. Love the location. On a quite street and close to everything. Amazing view of the city!!! I’d recommend this space to anyone traveling to NYC.

name: One Single Bed Room (標準單人房)
summary: 安靜簡潔單人房
description: 安靜簡潔單人房 交通四通八達
transit: 交通四通八達

address.street: 香港, 九龍, Hong Kong

reviews.comments: good location, nice staff.

name: Hawaii North Shore Oahu getaway!
space: You are looking at a beautiful private 1000 sq. foot space above garage unit with it's own entrance, luxury bathroom, and full kitchen. Perched on an amazingly landscaped estate with a gigantic lap pool, and gorgeous mountain views. Home is located on the hill of Pupukea which is one of the most sought after neighborhoods on the North Shore known for it's peace and quiet, spacious properties, and amazing views, but yet only being a 3 minute drive to the most popular surfing beaches in the world including Pipeline, Waimea Bay and Sunset Beach. Only 1 mile from the local supermarket, Foodland and 6 miles from our cute town of Haleiwa. It is newly remodeled home which has the look of a high end resort but the feeling of home. My husband and I live in the main home and are gracious and love to share our local knowledge of what to do and where to go. We have all the beach gear you need including boogie boards, snorkel gear, umbrellas ect. Rental comes fully furnished with a comfortable bed
description: You are looking at a beautiful private 1000 sq. foot space above garage unit with it's own entrance, luxury bathroom, and full kitchen. Perched on an amazingly landscaped estate with a gigantic lap pool, and gorgeous mountain views. Home is located on the hill of Pupukea which is one of the most sought after neighborhoods on the North Shore known for it's peace and quiet, spacious properties, and amazing views, but yet only being a 3 minute drive to the most popular surfing beaches in the world including Pipeline, Waimea Bay and Sunset Beach. Only 1 mile from the local supermarket, Foodland and 6 miles from our cute town of Haleiwa. It is newly remodeled home which has the look of a high end resort but the feeling of home. My husband and I live in the main home and are gracious and love to share our local knowledge of what to do and where to go. We have all the beach gear you need including boogie boards, snorkel gear, umbrellas ect. Rental comes fully furnished with a comfortable bed
house_rules: No Smoking on Property! No parties! Pool hours 10am-8pm Conserve energy by turning lights off when not home Please remove shoes, sand & dirt upon entering home No pets

host.host_about: Being locally born and raised in Hawaii and raising a family on the North Shore we are so excited to be able to share our new home with visitors from around world. Being avid surfers and living a healthy lifestyle is what we are all about. We have lots of advise and local knowledge to share and love to travel ourselves and meet new people.

reviews.comments: I couldn't have asked for a better studio with an incredible view of the valley and the North Shore. I feel as comfortable as I do at home with their house being located in a great neighborhood. You will not find better hosts than Love and Amy, and they were always checking up to see if there was anything we needed for a better experience. I will not stay anywhere else besides here when returning for the winter swells in December. The drive to the North shore beaches is only a minute drive down the hill with birds-eye scenery all the way to the bottom. Overall, if you are looking to have a home away from home, this is the place to be.

My husband and I loved staying at Amy and Love's North Shore Oahu Getaway!  The unit was easy to find and just as described in the listing.  The kitchenette had almost everything we could need and accommodated our cooking needs very well.  Although we only used it once, the pool was easily accessible and crystal clear.

The location was a bit away from the major cities, which was perfect for us, but would be something to consider for anyone looking to rent the unit, but also spend a lot of time in Waikiki or Honolulu.  We found that there was plenty to do on the North Shore that was very near to the unit, though.  Between Haleiwa, the Dole plantation, Sunset Beach, Waimea Bay, etc. there was a lot to explore in the immediate area.  Also, the restaurant recommendations that Amy and Love gave us were spot on (especially Opal's Thai restaurant in Haleiwa).

We would definitely return to Amy and Love's rental if on Oahu again!

My best friend and I stayed at Love and Amy's for 5 days at the beginning of May and wished we could have stayed for much longer. 
Love and Amy are fantastic, gracious hosts who made us feel totally welcome. They had some awesome recommendations for places to go and eat in town.
Their place is in an awesome location on Pupukea hill and is close to all the major things to do on the North Shore. It is a bright and airy space with gorgeous view of the vegetation outside. The kitchen had everything we needed and the bathroom was clean with a lovely large shower. 
We loved staying at Love and Amy's and will definitely be returning for longer in the near future.

We feel truly blessed to have landed at Love and Amy's door.  The apartment was beautiful-super clean, comfortable, well equipped kitchen, gorgeous bathroom and stunning grounds. We went there to relax before having our baby and I can't imagine anywhere else being this comfortable and calm for a couple expecting their first baby in a couple of moths.  Love was very helpful and kind with lots of great suggestions for the North Shore.  We would highly recommend their place to all our family and friends.  This was our first time using airbnb and we are very happy with our experience.

Vacationing in Hawaii itself is a fantastic thing, but when we decided to choose Amy's & Love's Studio we just made a wonderful vacation into an extraordinary experience! 
The studio is nicely equipped with all amenities and privacy that you need during your stay, the pool/hot tub are open for your use and also the pool area grill.
The main advantage about staying here are with your hosts, what a fantastic family, Amy, Love and Haven (not to mention TomTom, Polka and Rosemary, the family pets) are great, they are always available to help you with anything that  you would require.
They made our vacation an unforgettable and incredible time, we believe that we made new friends for life! 
We enjoyed every moment we spend in the island either relaxing in the beach, exploring the mountains, or only by simply sharing  a meal while having a great conversation with Amy and Love.
We were bitten by the island lifestyle bug and we are anxious to get back there soon! We know that we have fantastic friends there and will be a blast to see them again in the near future.
Thank you Amy, Love and Haven for your hospitality, friendship and kindness! We truly miss you guys!
Mahalo!
Alessandro and Juliana

We spent 5 days in the studio. It is a spacious room, very clean, bright and airy. The location is great-- it's a short drive to either sunset beach or waimea bay. 

The studio is great for sure but even better was getting to know Love and his family. As we were driving to the North Shore, Love called to see where we were and if we needed help in getting to the place. He was there to greet us as we drove up to the property and all through our stay was helpful and generous. We really felt like we were staying with a friend!

It's a great studio, wonderful owners and its reasonably priced. You can't do better if you are looking for a quiet place on the North Shore. We would highly recommend this place to anyone!

The accommodations showed in the photo are spot on. Very clean, modern, spacious and tranquil. Very high ceilings and a cool mountain breeze was an added bonus! Love made every effort to help us feel at home. He provided us with all of the necessary beach equipment i.e  beach chairs. umbrella, snorkel gear etc. Located in the heart of the north shore. Can't beat it!!!

Thanks Love!
WE LOVED IT!  Great North Shore location.  It was exactly as advertised and was a very comfortable, clean place to stay.  Love was an awesome host.

WOW, what more could we say? From the first email, Amy and Love were friendly and courteous, replying in a timely manner to all our emails.
 The studio was clean and neat, providing all that was needed for our vacation, from snorkel equipment, beach chairs, fresh fruit from the grounds and even a pool with a Jacuzzi. Just a couple minutes’ drive from Sharks Cove but tucked away in a safe, clean and relaxing neighborhood with a great view..
 Amy and Love were more than helpful and informative with all of our questions on hiking, surfing and of course local dining. 
 We can’t wait to visit Oahu again and of course we’ll be staying at the Hawaii Oahu North Shore getaway! 

Thanks again Amy and Love!

This was exactly what we wanted and to be away from the tourism and hotel/condo scene was perfect. It was truly an oasis! We also enjoyed the chickens and cat they own. I would love to come back here and bring our parents and have them stay in the pool house available for rent as well.

Love Hodel is an incredibly warm, attentive host and a genuinely interesting dude. 

My wife and I had the immense pleasure of staying at his North Shore studio during our honeymoon and we came away relaxed, beaming, and wanting desperately to return. Why? Let me explain.

First the property is quiet. I mean pin-drop quiet. Located just a short drive up a country road from the Food Land near Pupukea Beach (pro-tip: the ahi poke is marvelous), the loudest thing you’ll hear is the chirping of tropical birds (and maybe a rooster) early in the morning. At night you’ll see stars so vivid you’ll swear you’re in a planetarium. (Pro tip #2: bring a small flashlight - the country roads tend to be sparsely lit.) It’s only about a 7-minute drive down to the beach for some of the finest food, surf, and sand anywhere on the planet. 

Second, Love is one of the coolest, friendliest, and most mellow hosts we’ve ever encountered. A professional surfer/stuntman/fight coordinator (yes, people this cool actually exist) he went out of his way to make us feel like old friends. When the water heater broke during our stay did he toss up his hands and say, “I dunno what to do. Maybe shower at the beach?” Heck no, techno! He offered us the shower in the nearby pool house while ensuring the water heater in our unit was repaired quickly. 

Look, I’ve been to Oahu like a million times. If you’re mulling the merits of staying somewhere with a little more action - like say downtown Honolulu – don’t do it. It’s like sleeping in a hot metal garbage can while someone bangs on the outside with a hammer. Staying at Amy and Love’s place, on the other hand, is like getting a deep tissue Shiatsu massage while being spoon fed macadamia nut ice cream. 

During your stay you’ll find yourself asking questions like “I wonder how long I can extend my vacation without losing my job?” and  “How much does property cost on the North Shore?” While everyone will answer these queries differently one thing you’ll never question, if you stay at Amy and Love’s place, is your choice of accommodation.

We stayed in Amy & Love's studio for a week over the Thanksgiving holiday. The studio was perfect for us. It is clean and comfortable; being able to make food is great! Amy and Love generously shared their land with us as well, letting us pick starfruit and swim in the pool/hot tub. Their son Haven came to play with our son Rex and the whole family brought us into their home, even offering to share Thanksgiving with us.
We enjoyed this studio and would definitely stay here again when returning to the North Shore.

The place is just perfect. Modern kitchen, modern bathroom, great apartment. Located in a calm area, but really close to everything if you take the car. Love such a great host! He was super cool , easygoing and nice! He also helped us to get some surf lessons. I definitely recommend this place!

I'll let all the other great reviews speak for me. 
This is just as you see & read, if you want a quiet getaway but close to everything the North shore has to offer, and only 70 minutes to The furthest possible points on the island, then this is a wonderful choice.

I could just repeat the previous comments! It's a great place on north shore with very nice, helpful and welcoming hosts! we had everything we could ask for. 
We loved to stay here and it was the perfect place to come after super busy and touristy Honolulu.
The only thing a regret a little is not having taken a surf (Website hidden by Airbnb) DO IT!

Amy and Love's place was absolutely wonderful. We have been to the North Shore three times and stayed at AirBnB residences each time. Amy and Love's place was hands down the best, not that the others were bad. Everything is as advertised so I don't need to  regurgitate the other reviews. The living space was comfortable and had everything you need to make meals. We recommend them to anyone looking for wonderful residence on the North Shore.

If you are staying in the northshore it is the best place you could find!
Everything was perfect, small Kitchen well equiped, nice bathroom, very good bed, nice pool... Everything you will need for a wonderful stay is there, Even snorkel gear, beach towels and beach chairs!
Love is a very nice host and we hope to come back soon with our family... 
I definetly recommand it!!!!
Aloha from France

My wife and I could not have enjoyed our time more at Amy and Loves place.  The place is clean, quiet, comfortable and close to everything on the North Shore. All of the communications with Love were very prompt and gracious. Kept in touch with me very late in the evening with our arrival due to airline issues and even offered late check out with our late departing flights. I will certainly recommend this place to anyone wanting to visit the North Shore and we hope to return again. Thanks to Love and Amy's place out trip was very relaxing and everything we wanted for a Hawaiian vacation.

We had a great time. The nearest beach is Shark's Cove, which is just down hill from their place (a few minutes drive). They keep the place tidy and clean, and the bed was comfortable. The windows are big and bring in a lot of light. It may not feel super private, as there are no curtains on some of the windows. But, at night, there is no noise pollution and we slept great. Amy and Love are also very helpful and friendly. Thanks for having us!

This was our first trip to Oahu and the Hodel's studio on the North Shore was the perfect place to stay. It was modern, clean, quiet and safe. We were off the beaten path, which is exactly what we wanted. Love told us about the best local places to eat and hang out at the beach. He was available if we had questions or needed anything. We can't wait until our next visit!

The studio is spacious and clean. The kitchen came with everything we needed to prepare meals. Love was very prompt when we made a couple of special requests. We were very comfortable with the neighborhood, and enjoyed walks in the afternoon. Nice space, great hosts, would stay again.

My boyfriend and I stayed at Love´s place for 2 weeks, and everything was great. The owner is very helpful with his detailed diretcions to get to the house and other questions we had. The apartment is big, with a great bathroom, very close to all the North Shore beaches. There is a supermarket (Foodland) 5 min driving. I thought it would be kinda "desert" around the house, but I was wrong: it is surronded by beautifull houses until you reach a very short road that leads to the beach. Love and Amy were very friendly, I would recommend this place for anyone!

Amy and Love were exceptional. Very nice to deal with and a pleasure to rent from  They have the perfect set up for anyone wanting to experience the North Shore of Oahu. Love put us right at ease and made us feel like family. We woke up to the sounds of birds in the lush tropical setting where their house sits high atop a mountain. The place was immaculate and very up to date. The proximity to everything on the North Shore can not be beat. It was very private like having your own guest house. Nice and quiet surroundings. A class act to say the least. I felt like I hit the jackpot of places to stay on the North Shore. I hope to book more dates in the future with them. Can not say enough good things about my experience there. Mahalo Amy and Love….

Amy and Love were awesome! Their place is absolutely beautiful, and so clean and cozy. It's just a short drive to some of the most beautiful beaches, and fun things to do on North Shore. I would definitely stay here again and will be recommending it to friends as well. Thank you Amy and Love!

We loved it here! It's a perfect place to feel at home in North Shore.  Love was very friendly and ensured that we were doing fine in the midst of a possible hurricane. The description and pictures are very accurate. The location is beautiful and a quick drive to wonderful beaches.  I would be happy to stay here again.
Great spot on the north shore. We had a great time! Everything went smoothly.
We loved our stay on the North Shore and felt very welcomed by Love and Amy. The studio is clean, modern, quite, and peaceful! I highly recommend this place.

Amy & Love's place was truly a home away from home. They are in a beautiful location only a few minutes from the beach. We had everything we needed in the full kitchen and really nice bathroom. The bed was also nice and comfortable. It was an ideal space for the two of us.  Amy and Love were very nice hosts and a super cute family. They were around whenever we had questions and also helped set us up with surfing lessons. Overall, we would definitely recommend this place and it is totally worth the money.

This was the perfect homebase to our week on Oahu.  The property is very large with lots of fruit trees, and natural vegetation.  There is a large lap pool.  We stayed in the studio.  Very simple furnishings, beautiful wooden ceilings and beautiful bathroom.  It was exactly what we were looking for.  It is located in a wonderful neighborhood and we often ran the hills in the morning.  I think the location cannot be beat!  You are close to all the main surf beaches on the North Shore.  Amy and Love were so great! They were friendly, kind and very fun to talk with.  They were there to help you and were the perfect hosts!

This place is great! Amy and Love are great hosts, made us feel welcome at their very private guest room and gave us great suggestions for activities. The room is over the garage with a private staircase and is exactly like the photos. The kitchen is well equipped and the bathroom is very nice too. The neighborhood is beautiful and quiet. About 20 minutes to Haleiwa, 10 minutes to Weimea Valley and 5 minutes to the supermarket. Fun and easy!
The place was exactly as described. The hosts were helpful and very friendly.

We absolutely loved our visit! Amy & Love's home is in a beautiful quiet neighborhood and is very close the water and to everything the North Shore has to offer. The apartment was very clean and has cooking pots and dishes if you're looking to have a few meals at the house (although, make sure you visit local food stands and restaurants!)  The studio is very private. We were very quiet guests and were essentially off every morning on our own adventures, but Love was incredibly nice and was sure to check in with us. The place has a great big bath, beautiful wood beam ceiling, very comfy bed and beautiful lush surroundings. Haleiwa is such a beautiful area and we wish we could have stayed longer to explore more.

This spot on the North Shore of Oahu was fantastic! Love was very helpful and kept in touch the whole time we were there. He made sure that we had everything that we needed. I truly felt at home. I can't wait to come back!

My girlfriend and I loved staying at Love and Amy's place. It was the perfect North Shore get away and took us away from all the Honolulu tourist traps. We really loved being close to Waimea Bay and Pupukea Beach for the snorkeling. It was quiet and the grounds were peaceful. Thanks again Love!

Love was a great host. I booked his place at the last minute, actually while boarding a plane to fly to Hawaii. Since it was last minute and his normal house cleaner wasn't available, he personally was cleaning the apartment when I arrived. He allowed me to check in early so I could drop off my stuff in a safe location and hit the surf. The place is in a quite neighborhood up the the hill from the only grocery store in the area, Foodland. The location was convenient for getting everywhere on the North Shore and since it is up in Pupukea it is a little cooler, which is great when sleeping at night with the windows open. Since I was flying out on a red-eye, Love also allowed me to checkout late since no one was renting the place for a few days.

Love was a great host, attentive and polite. This place is in the perfect location on the North shore, good access to shops, restaurants and all the stunning beaches on the North. A beautiful property,tropical relaxed and cozy feeling. Very spacious,clean and perfect for a couple. Peaceful at night with a comfortable bed and wifi access. The pool looks fantastic even though we were so busy touring around Hawaii we didn't have time to use it. I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a good spot to take in the laid back North shore vibe. We can't wait to go back!!! PS make sure to check out the restaurants recommended by Love & Amy in the arrival welcome booklet.

For us, this was the perfect location on the North Shore.  Amy and Love were great and the little bungalow was excellent for 2.  Very unusual to have a pool but it was a welcome addition for the days when we returned home late in the afternoon and were looking for a little quiet time.  We will definitely be returning! mahalo

My boyfriend and I had an amazing week-long stay at Amy and Love's place. The apartment was clean and comfortable. The location was beautiful, very scenic. Love and Amy were very communicative and gracious hosts. We are so happy that we opted to rent a car and stay on the North Shore for our vacation instead of staying at one of the high-rises on Waikiki. We definitely recommend staying here!

What perfect and peaceful home! Love and Amy provided a great place to stay. We were greeted with lychee from their tree and a super friendly cat named Tom. Everything we needed was there,easy, and it was nice to be in the quiet and still close to everything you want on the North Shore. You could really hear the wildlife and sounds of Hawaii. The apartment was a good size with all the amenities.
Thanks again Love and Amy! Aloha

If you're headed to the North Shore, this is a great place to stay. Amy and Love are super friendly hosts and they have a beautiful property. My boyfriend and I spent 5 nights here but wish we could've stayed longer. The unit is spacious, very clean and quiet. It's situated in a pretty neighborhood and we loved that we were just a quick drive away from so many gorgeous beaches. It's also just up the hill from Foodland, which made grocery shopping easy and convenient. We highly recommend this spot and we already can't wait to go back. Thank you!

My husband and I spent nine nights in Oahu and thoroughly enjoyed our stay on the North Shore. Love was a great host and the place was exactly what we wanted for our stay. We would definitely return again.

Amy and Love are the perfect hosts and their guest home is the perfect getaway on the north shore of Oahu.  I have stayed at this property long term in the summer and have had no problems! 

The space has vaulted ceilings which give such an open air feel along with a large bathroom and living space. 

Love and Amy are gracious hosts and can recommend all local activities and to do’s! 

I would recommend staying at their property to any family and friends staying on the north shore of Oahu and will definitely being staying with them again in the future!

name: WAIKIKI GARDEN APARTMENT (Two week minimum)
summary: This is a clean, attractive apartment with a garden terrace and with easy access to the bus line, shopping, and restaurants and is located two short blocks from the beach and Kapiolani Park on the Diamond Head end of Waikiki. A two week minimum stay is firm.  Discounts are available for stays of 3 or more months.  One indoor parking space is included with the apartment.
space: The apartment includes all furnishings; bed linens, towels, and has a full kitchen and is steps away from the swimming pool, tennis courts, and BBQ area and coin laundry.   One unassigned indoor parking space is  included with the apartment. Light housekeeping and garden maintenance (watering)  provided every 7 days (approx. 2 hrs.)   Guest(s) responsible for laundering of bed linens and towels provided.   Just bring your clothes and a toothbrush!  (Absolutely No Pets allowed and no smoking.) NOTE:  The king size bed can be configured into two twin sized beds at your request.
description: This is a clean, attractive apartment with a garden terrace and with easy access to the bus line, shopping, and restaurants and is located two short blocks from the beach and Kapiolani Park on the Diamond Head end of Waikiki. A two week minimum stay is firm.  Discounts are available for stays of 3 or more months.  One indoor parking space is included with the apartment. The apartment includes all furnishings; bed linens, towels, and has a full kitchen and is steps away from the swimming pool, tennis courts, and BBQ area and coin laundry.   One unassigned indoor parking space is  included with the apartment. Light housekeeping and garden maintenance (watering)  provided every 7 days (approx. 2 hrs.)   Guest(s) responsible for laundering of bed linens and towels provided.   Just bring your clothes and a toothbrush!  (Absolutely No Pets allowed and no smoking.) NOTE:  The king size bed can be configured into two twin sized beds at your request. Guests' have access to a private garden, the
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is two blocks from the beaches at Waikiki and two blocks from the Honolulu Zoo and Kapiolani Park.  Shopping and restaurants are plentiful in the area and within walking distance.  The area is easily accessible to surf/boogie boarding spots, walking, jogging, and cycling areas.  If you like quiet beaches, there is a beautiful shoreline from Diamond Head lighthouse to Kahala; only a 20 minute walk through the park or a 10 minute drive up Diamond Head Road.
notes: The apartment has a private terraced garden.   The owner/agent will need access to the apartment for light housekeeping and maintenance/watering of the garden for approximately 2 hours every 7 days; (usually on Fridays.)
transit: The apartment is a short block away from bus stops going in and out of town.  Taxi cabs are available 24/7 right outside the lobby.  There is also shuttle service to and from all hotels to the airport.  Arrangements can be made online or by phone.  There are building security guards always on site.
access: Guests' have access to a private garden, the building pool, tennis courts, and BBQ area. Laundry facilities are available on each floor.  One parking space is included with the apartment rental. Security guards are on site 24/7.
interaction: An owner/agent will be available to greet you when you arrive and will be accessible throughout your stay.
house_rules: No smoking in the apartment or on the terrace Quiet time 10pm-7am No pets Maximum two (2) guests only

host.host_about: I am a long time resident of Honolulu.  I have experience in hospitality and customer relations.  I work as an artist and can be seen exhibiting my paintings at the local venue called 'Art on the Zoo Fence' on Monsarrat Ave in Waikiki on Saturdays and Sundays.  My artwork can also be viewed online at, gordon- (Website hidden by Airbnb)    I enjoy wine, good food,  music, travel, art, nature,  and gardening.  I'm happiest on a ship sailing to exotic ports!

reviews.comments: The host met me when I arrived, helped me with my luggage, and gave me a quick orientation. As I was jet lagged, I especially appreciated the light breakfast left for me so I didn't have to go out foraging that first groggy morning. There was great communication before and throughout the stay and the host was gracious, immediately responsive, and very accommodating. The kitchen was well stocked with essentials and I was able to immediately settle in. The apartment was actually better than the listing - the lanai is HUGE and the lanai's private garden was a relaxing, beautiful oasis. It has a great view of Diamond Head as well. The apartment itself is newly renovated and gorgeous; I was the envy of my colleagues who were staying in small studios. Instead of the typical, just tolerable hotel furniture, the apartment had quality, comfortable pieces, and the overall design was great. The colors, artwork, finishes, everything about the decor was thoughtful and pleasing. The bedding and towels were great quality. I was surprised to find that beach chairs, boogie boards, beach umbrella, beach towels, snorkel gear, etc. were provided as well. I seriously had everything I needed for a beach vacation. The apartment doesn't have its own washer and dryer, but the community laundry room was down the hall and I rarely found the machines occupied, so it wasn't a big deal. I loved the location. The building is a hotel/condo combo and only two blocks from the beach, but in a quieter part of Waikiki so it was less hectic. There is still some street noise, of course - it's an urban area - but I never closed the windows and I slept just fine. If I had closed the windows and used the AC I wouldn't have heard anything. I had a car during my stay, which I kept in the building's garage, but only needed to use it when I left Waikiki. Otherwise, everything in Waikiki is walkable. I've stayed in hotels in Waikiki before many times and this was a much better experience; I loved staying here and it was a real pleasure to come back to this apartment at the end of every day. If I ever get a chance to come back for 30+ days again, I'm definitely going to try to stay here again. Highly recommend this apartment and host!

My aunt and uncle, both in their golden years, had a wonderful two  month stay in this lovely home.  The apartment was exceptionally comfortable and just the right size for them.  The terrace, which almost doubled the size of the unit, brought a beautiful Hawaiian landscape to their door. The location was perfect for them because of the public transportation close by, as well as restaurants and shopping.  Gordon and Ray were the perfect hosts.

I loved the place and location and my whole trip on Oahu was made better having such great accommodations. I highly recommend this apartment for anyone coming to the area. It really has everything you could need for your stay, including kitchen items, beach gear, bath towels etc. The garden terrace really does double the space and is a great addition to the apartment. There are so many plants you feel like you are in your own tropical oasis. There is so much in walking distance of the apartment, including the beach, shops and restaurants. If you are coming to Waikiki, don't pass up the opportunity to stay here. Gordon and Ray are exceptional hosts who will help to make your stay the best one.

This is fantastic apartment. It is located in the best part of Waikiki: close to everything, 4 mins walk to the less-crowded part of the beach, 9 mins walk to main shopping. The apartment is very beautiful and functional. All in perfect condition. The terrace of the apartment is large and stunning. Nothing as peaceful as having a coffee there in the morning or reading a book while enjoying sea breeze in the afternoon. The terrace really puts this apartment way above any other option. The building is very good. There is a convenience store and a garage (to which the hosts provided us with a key). There is also a pool and a tennis court. The hosts are absolutely gracious, and went out of their way to welcome us and make us feel comfortable. Thanks very much to Gordon and Ray!
Great spot, was very happy to stay there. Thank you.

Highly recommend. Plenty of space for 2 people plus room to work for those that cannot escape the office whilst on holidays. Have stayed in a lot of BNB's around the world and this rates up there with the best.

The apartment was amazing and everything we needed. It was so close to the beach,restaurants, shops etc. Gordon was fantastic very accomadating with checking in and out times. The welcome pack was a great help to give us, tips for activities and restaurants. The hosts were greats at recommending place also. We had an amazing stay and would definitely recommend Gordon's apartment.

What an amazing stay!  We’ve been to Hawaii numerous times and I can honestly say that this place is the best we’ve stayed in.  Not only are Gordon and Ray wonderful hosts, they are great people.  They maintain the property very well and are very helpful with providing tips on the area  to make sure our trip was memorable.  

The property is a great size for two people and is very warm and inviting.   I’m impressed with the detail and care they put to the place from the well groomed garden in the lanai (it’s gorgeous) to the personal touches in the home such as their artwork and furniture.   I worked during some of the trip and this place is ideal for me to concentrate and focus.   I’ve escaped to the lanai many times!   

This truly is an oasis in Waikiki and we can’t wait to come back again soon!
Beautiful apartment with all you need and more. Ray was incredibly kind, informative and attentive.

Quel bel appartement, décoré avec goût, nous avons adoré la terrasse le plus de cet endroit, entouré de plante et très bien entretenu. Gordon et Raymond sont adorable et nous ont bien conseillé. Vous trouverez les plages, bus et commerces tout proche à pied. Il ne manque rien dans l'appartement de plus la piscine se trouve au même étage et la laverie aussi très pratique. Une petite supérette se trouve à l'étage au dessous pour dépanner. Bref, un séjour inoubliable.

Gordon is a superb host!  He ensured we were properly brief on the quarters and surrounding area.  I’ve come to Honolulu every year for the past 25 years for one month.  This is by far the best lodging experience I’ve had to date with Airbnb!  I highly recommend this property and plan to rent it this time next year!!!

name: Quarto e sala a 100m da praia
summary: Apartamento de sala e quarto com acomodação SOMENTE para 4 pessoas, em frente da praia da Barra da Tijuca.Excelente localização em condomínio residencial,familiar e seguro.
space: Excelentes acomodações para 4 pessoas,ambiente acolhedor em um lugar privilegiado.
description: Apartamento de sala e quarto com acomodação SOMENTE para 4 pessoas, em frente da praia da Barra da Tijuca.Excelente localização em condomínio residencial,familiar e seguro. Excelentes acomodações para 4 pessoas,ambiente acolhedor em um lugar privilegiado. Acesso dos hospedes a sauna,academia,churrasqueira e áreas comuns do condomínio. Estaremos a disposição para esclarecer qq dúvida em relação ao local,dicas do lugar,etc... Bairro q possui tudo para entretenimento,enaltecendo uma das mais belas praias da cidade.E mais,shoppings,restaurantes e bares de excelente nível.Transporte público na porta do condomínio,mercado e padaria a 200m. O apartamento possui estacionamento gratuito,e transporte público em frente ao condomínio.
neighborhood_overview: Bairro q possui tudo para entretenimento,enaltecendo uma das mais belas praias da cidade.E mais,shoppings,restaurantes e bares de excelente nível.Transporte público na porta do condomínio,mercado e padaria a 200m.
transit: O apartamento possui estacionamento gratuito,e transporte público em frente ao condomínio.
access: Acesso dos hospedes a sauna,academia,churrasqueira e áreas comuns do condomínio.
interaction: Estaremos a disposição para esclarecer qq dúvida em relação ao local,dicas do lugar,etc...
house_rules: Esperamos que respeitem a lei do silêncio,já q o condomínio é um lugar familiar,e não é permitido que fume dentro do apartamento.Que respeitem e conservem o lugar como se fosse sua casa,entregando o apartamento como recebeu!!!

host.host_location: Rio de Janeiro, State of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
host.host_about: Recebendo com simpatia e disponibilidade todos seus hóspedes!!!

address.street: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

reviews.comments:
Excelente acomodação, na rua da praia da Barra perto de tudo, mercado, restaurante, baladas. 
Praticamente pé na areia. 
Ao lado do Sheraton. 
Muito bom, adorei!
Excelente localização em frente à praia e ótima recepção dos anfitriões!

Desde el primer momento de contratar y durante toda la estadía en Río,  Erika respondió amablemente todas mis consultas al instante, me asesoró en lo que necesité y me dio mucha tranquilidad saber que contaba con ella para cualquier eventualidad y nos sentimos muy agradecidos por ello. El lugar es tal cual se describe, fui con mi marido y mis dos hijos adolescentes ( 12 y 17) y nos sentimos muy cómodos. Nos esperaba el Papá de Erika, muy amable, con varias bebidas frescas, leche, manteca, pan, bombones que nos fueron de utilidad por el horario en que llegamos a instalarnos. La cocina está completa para cocinar, hay cafetera, tostadora, toallas de cocina, manteles, hay agua caliente, hay ventiladores de techo en ambos ambientes y aire acondicionado, tiene placares grandes, y teníamos sabanas limpias y varias toallas. El baño tenía jabón, pasta dental y papel higiénico. Había sombrillas y sillas para playa, que nos vinieron muy bien. Saliendo del condominio, que tiene seguridad las 24hs. y cruzando la calle está la playa que es bellísima  y con olas muy divertidas.  Esta el Sheraton muy cerquita, hay bares y restó, cajero, kioscos, y hay un sector que tiene farmacia, mercado, panadería y comida lista para llevar o consumir ahí mismo,  todo ello  a 2 /3 cuadras. El Papa de Erika, muy amable, llevo en su auto a mi marido para indicarle el lugar de compras. Respecto al transporte hay taxis a cada instante y pasan líneas de colectivos. El lugar y la ubicación son justos para una disfrutar una excelente estadía en esa linda ciudad. Muy agradecidos con Erika y su Papa! Hasta la vuelta!

Eu fui ao Rio de Janeiro com uma amiga/colega de trabalho para um congresso. A nossa estadia no apartamento da Erika foi no geral boa. O apartamento é pequeno, mas é completo. Tem cadeiras de praia, guarda-sol, cafeteira, torradeira... O Sr. Waldyr nos recebeu com muita atenção e preocupação, mostrou-nos o apartamento, explicou algumas coisas, e até mesmo deixou água, sucos e refrigerantes na geladeira para nos receber. A receptividade dele foi extraordinária. Os únicos aspectos que nos decepcionaram e foram pontos negativos foram não ter wifi no apartamento e sim no condomínio e com sinal extremamente fraco, o que nos impossibilitou de utilizá-lo e o colchão, que era muito firme/duro não sendo confortável.

El apartamento es super recomendable, excelente ubicación. La playa excelente y los transportes muy cerca. El apartamento tiene todos los servicios, aunque la red wi fi no funciona muy bien. Erika estuvo atenta al (Hidden by Airbnb) y a todas nuestras necesidades.
El lugar es tal cual se describe, fui con mi marido y mis dos hijos ( 9 y 12 años) y nos sentimos muy cómodos. Aunque nos desencontramos con el papá de Erika (llegamos el 25/12 con demoras) nos esperaba el departamento con varias bebidas frescas y bombones
